description:
Updated 2 bedrooms apartment in the heart of Chicago. Bus stop at the corner running every 15 minutes, expressway 10 minutes away and Wrigley field only 15 minutes away. Lots of amazing restaurants in the area that are in walking distance. Downtown is a 25 minute drive.

Updated apartment from front to back!! Two bedrooms make it great for two families or friends to stay together

Entire apartment

Message me if you have any questions

Bus stop at corner, Uber is great as well. Street parking available

access: Guests will have access to the entire apartment.
description:
The apartment is spacious, close to the 'L' (subway), and right on the corner of DePaul. Great for city visits or college visit with easy access to downtown. It's a modern apartment with new appliances and a fantastic roof deck. There's a number of fast food and other dining alternatives nearby and easy access to the lake front. The neighborhood is relatively quiet and neighbors are friendly.

The apartment is in a very new building with modern living space. The appliances are all modern and relatively new. The apartment is nearly all hardwood (tile bathrooms). In the center of the apartment there is a spiral staircase to the private roof deck. There is also a patio space on the main floor with a grill and table.

Guests will have access to the entire apartment.

Typically I'll be out of town during your stay, but should anything come up that you need I am available by phone. Should any Emergency arise I also have friends in the area who can help.

Close to the 'L' (about a 7 minute walk), but the easiest way to get downtown or up to Wrigley is usually taking an Uber/Lyft ~$12 or UberPool ~$4 (if you have some extra time)

access:
The Den is the perfect space to relax and hang out or get some work done. Our guest kitchen is  available for food storage and meal preparation. Coin-operated laundry facilities are on-site.

Broken Shaker, our James Beard Award-nominated cocktail bar, is open daily at 4:00pm for drinks, food, and fun.
description:
Join us at Freehand Chicago Hotel for your travels in Chicago. Perfect for travelers here too long for a traditional hotel or for just 1 night; make us your home away from home.

This listing is for one bunk for one person in a shared mixed/co-ed room with 4 bunks (up to 3 roommates). We have many options such as private standard rooms and private quad rooms. Please send us a message with any questions.

$2 nightly resort fee

Somewhere between a hostel and hotel, you'll find the amenities you need to get through anywhere from a week to a few months. This listing is for one twin bunk in a shared room with four total bunks, so you would have up to 3 roommates. The room has a private bathroom and lockers for storing valuables. Each bunk features a curtain for privacy, reading lamp, and power outlet. Linens and towels are included, as is regular housekeeping service. 

Please ask the front desk if you need complimentary extra towels, blankets, or toiletries.

The Den is the perfect space to relax and hang out or get some work done. Our guest kitchen is  available for food storage and meal preparation. Coin-operated laundry facilities are on-site.

Broken Shaker, our James Beard Award-nominated cocktail bar, is open daily at 4:00pm for drinks, food, and fun.

There is always an agent at the front desk.

The Freehand Chicago is near the corner of Ohio and State st. It is downtown in the heart of River North, 1 block from the Magnificent Mile, 1 block across the River from The Loop, and a quick walk, bus, train, or taxi to anywhere you need to go.  Check out Cafe Integral and Broken Shaker for your breakfast, lunch, dinner, and drink needs - we are also conveniently located across the street from Jewel, a major grocery store chain.

The hotel offers parking to guests for $39 / night with free in and out privileges at a garage 1 block south of the hotel called The Grand Plaza. The address of the entrance is 18 W Grand Ave. If you park there, please just stop at the front desk for an exit ticket any time you'd like to take the car out.

Your room and tax will be prepaid through Airbnb, but the hotel requires a $50 deposit for incidentals on a card at check in per room, per stay. We do not accept gift cards, prepaid cards, or cash for incidentals. The deposit will be released back to your card at checkout provided you do not charge anything to your room. It takes most banks 3-7 business days to process the release.

$2 nightly resort fee

access: You have access to all 4 suites, the gym, the patios, and the laundry in the lower level.
description:
Welcome to our MEGA Loft Suites, comprised of 4 conjoining lofts inn the heart of Chicago! When you are here, your walk score is 97 & your transit score is100. 

Guests love our homes because:
- Sleep 30+
-Lots of natural light
-High loft ceilings
-FAST WIFI
-Spacious layout
-Comfy beds
-Central Location
-Private Balcony!
-Close proximity to Grant Park, Soldier Field, Museums, and more!

We look forward to having you at our home!

(Pssst... Quick favor if you're thinking about booking: Please read the entire listing as it likely answers any questions you may have. Thanks!) 

Here are the individual listings for each home:
https://airbnb.com/h/penthouse806
https://airbnb.com/h/plymouth805
https://airbnb.com/h/penthouse804
https://airbnb.com/h/plymouth803

To access the building, we give you a simple code to go in-and-out as you please. You walk up the stairs to the elevators, and take the elevator to the top floor, the 8th floor.

When you exit the elevator, you turn right and then left down the hallway to your homes. 
When you enter each home, they open to an open, spacious loft. There is a dining area, a kitchen, a living room, a half bathroom,and private patio for those staying on the first level. 

There are 3 private patios for your access.

If you walk up to the 2nd floor, you will find a spacious loft with two full size beds, a huge closet,  and a full bathroom. This is truly a special place, and we look forward to making your stay a 5-star experience!

Q: Is the neighborhood safe?
A: Very much so. 24 hours a day.

Q: PARKING?
A: The home is very easy to get to via public transit. If you decide to drive, we recommend apps like SpotAngel or SpotHero to find free or cheap parking ($10-20 / night). 

Q: Do I need to bring towels, a hair dryer, or linens?
A: Nope! we provide all these things. Same with hotel-size toiletries (unless I happen to be out, which is rare).

Q: When can I check in or check out? 
A: Check in is 4pm and check out is 10am. Early check ins can be difficult if there are guests who checked out same day. We ask for an early check-in, or a late-check out fee, if you request either.

Q: Can I come and go as I please?
A: Yes. And we wouldn't trust any listing with which this isn't the case.

Q: Is the place professionally cleaned between guests?
A: Yes, and we take pride in providing a clean home for guests.

Q: What's my total booking price? 
A: We honestly have no idea. With fees included, it only shows the guest how much they pay. This figure should be present after you enter your dates. Note that, pricing varies on a daily basis, and it actually uses some crazy algorithm to adjust it automatically, so I don't actually control this.

Q: Are the beds comfortable?
A: Very. Some guests say they're the best they've ever slept on!

Q: Is this all one unit? 
A: No. Just to be clear these are four separate units that are all right next to each other in an exclusive area on the top floor.

You have access to all 4 suites, the gym, the patios, and the laundry in the lower level.

We're here to help as you need it! We give all of our guests full itinerary for their trip 2 days before their stay.

Printers Row is ‚Äúpocket‚Äù neighborhood  just minutes from the Chicago Loop. After the Great Chicago Fire of 1871, the area became the Midwest hub of the printing industry with historically significant buildings designed by legendary architects like Daniel Burnham, William Holabird and William Le Baron Jenney. Today, many of those historic buildings remain but the quiet, tree lined streets are now largely residential. Of course, it continues to be a draw for fans of Chicago architecture.

During the day, the neighborhood is an easy walk to offices in the Loop, off Michigan Avenue, or in LaSalle Street financial centers. After hours, the district is alive with restaurants, boutiques, book and antique stores.

It boasts famous blues clubs, eclectic music venues and neighborhood taverns where residents gather. It also has an annual book fair: The Printers Row Book Fair gathers authors, poets, speakers and, of course, books.

Printer's Row is also walking distance to Chicago's Museum Campus, with the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium, and the newly redesigned Soldier Field.

With a 97 walk score and 100 transit score, you can get everywhere your heart desires in Chicago. The Red Line subway is one of the main subways in Chicago, and is only a block away. Many restaurants, shopping, parks, and museums are within walking distance.

No local guests
$1000 smoking/party fee
house_rules:
No Local Guests
Quiet Hours: 10pm to 8am

access: You have access to the entire space during your stay.
description:
Stunning 3BR apartment in the heart of Old Town. You cannot beat this location! Situated behind the Wells Street entertainment and dining district, you're only a few steps from all the best restaurants, bars, venues and transportation. Old Town is home to famous Second City and Zanie's comedy clubs. 

NOTE: these pictures reflect our upstairs unit. We will have updated pictures April 5th with the same layout and beds.

Registration Number: R19000044618

You'll feel right at home with our cozy living room, vaulted ceilings, fully stocked kitchen, Netflix, and memory foam mattresses. We cater to the needs of our business-savvy clients, so we have provided a laptop-friendly workspace and fast WiFi throughout the space. There are also two full-length mirrors, a washer/dryer on-site and a lockbox available. Leave your iron and hair dryer at home. We‚Äôve got you covered.

You have access to the entire space during your stay.

Hi, please be aware that there are strict parking regulations out front. If you are parking your car on the street please know the street closest to us (southbound) is restricted from 7am - 9am due to rush hour. On the other side it is restricted from 4pm - 6pm. The city will tow your car if you are parked in those spots during those times. 

If you car is towed, the pound is at Address: 400 E Lower Wacker Dr, Chicago, IL 60601

The owner lives on the first floor of the building, so please be mindful of noise during your stay. Please DO NOT USE FIREPLACE.

access: Aside from the bedroom, guests are welcome to use the kitchen, dining room, and porch areas of the house.  Cold and hot coffee are available and our fridge is available for your use/ storage.
description:
Our Humboldt Park home features 1.5 bathrooms & a queen size bedroom with air conditioning.  Close to the north ave (72) bus & minutes from the hippest neighborhoods in the city- Wicker Park and Logan Square.

Old 120-year-old farm house appeal.  Not a typical city dwelling.  We have an ongoing exhibition of local, outsider artwork throughout our space.

Aside from the bedroom, guests are welcome to use the kitchen, dining room, and porch areas of the house.  Cold and hot coffee are available and our fridge is available for your use/ storage.

We'd love to help you navigate the city and give you our feedback as well as share what we love about Chicago.

Humboldt Park is an emerging Chicago neighborhood on the near west side.  It's close enough to Wicker Park, Bucktown, and Logan Square that you can easily get to these neighborhoods by bus or lyft/uber but far enough away that it's quiet when you want it to be.  

The park is BEAUTIFUL and offers swimming, fishing, tennis, baseball, and soccer. 

We are also a 5-minute walk to the 606 bike/walk path that enters on either Drake or Lawndale.  This bike path will take you to the Wicker Park, south Logan Square, and Bucktown neighborhoods.

We are right by the North Ave  (72) bus that will take you to the Blue L line in 15 minutes and the Red L line in a half hour. Also a short distance from the Chicago (66) bus that will take you to the Red L line.  Lyft/Uber are your best bets in our neighborhood because we are a little ways from city action.

My husband, Dave, is a local Chicago chef and is available for a private tasting menu at our house if you'd like to book that with your stay (not included in Airbnb fees).
house_rules:
Smoking outside, please. 

We have an old Chocolate lab who is friendly and gets along great with FEMALE dogs.   If you are interested in bringing your dog, please let us know.

description:
We know the difficulties of deciding where to eat and what to do in one of the world‚Äôs most happening cities. But with the posh comfort and convenience of the Staypineapple in central Chicago, choosing where to stay will be easy. 

Your room charge and taxes will be paid prior to your arrival. The amenity fee with tax ($17.61 per day) will be charged upon arrival.

The rooms feature a blend of contemporary design with original elegant details and modern furnishings. Large windows allow scenic views of the city, while duvet beds with luxury towels and robes provide maximum comfort. All units include high speed Wi-Fi and complimentary Kuerig coffee and tea.

Staypineapple is conveniently located within steps to many of Chicago‚Äôs top attractions including Millennium Park, the Art Institute of Chicago, and the Magnificent Mile. The Theater District is also just minutes away, and with hundreds of options for world-renown bars and restaurants, you‚Äôll have no trouble finding a great place to hang before and after the show.

Your room will have: 

Air conditioning
Non-smoking rooms
Daily housekeeping
Room service

Unlimited in-room Keurig¬Æ with custom blended coffee and tea

The space offers:

Fitness Center
Bar/Lounge
Business Center
Concierge
Conference Facilities
Dry Cleaning
Laundry Service
Meeting rooms
Multilingual Staff
Pets Allowed
Wheelchair access

access: The entire first floor is shared space (all the bedrooms are upstairs). You will have access to: a modern kitchen stocked with complimentary breakfast items; a sound insulated theater equipped with Netflix, Showtime and an Xbox; a spacious living room with comfortable seating, a record player and a fine selection of vinyl; a dining room that seats 12-16 people; washer and dryer with free detergent/dryer sheets, and a picnic table and firepit in our big backyard which is fenced-in and dog-friendly.
description:
The Greenleaf House, built in 1915, is our 3600ft¬≤ home with 6 bedrooms, 2.5 baths, & an open floor plan‚Äîperfect for gatherings of any kind. We're in the heart of the Rogers Park neighborhood, walking distance from many restaurants & 1 block from Loyola Beach Park. Breakfast is self-serve & included in the cost of the room. In the kitchen you will find bagels, cream cheese, eggs, yogurt, cereal & fresh fruit. The home is run by friendly local folks who are happy to help during your stay.

This brand new Deluxe bunk is newly installed to replace the loft space. There are two full bathrooms just a few steps down the hall which are shared with other guests.

Also available in the Greenleaf House are rooms with king, queen, or single sized beds. There are two rooms with loft beds, which are suitable for adults or perfect for children. All rooms are private, have their own closet and dresser, and are equipped with front-door-style locks, for which you will be provided a key. Whole house rentals are also available.

https://www.airbnb.com/users/5468317/listings

The entire first floor is shared space (all the bedrooms are upstairs). You will have access to: a modern kitchen stocked with complimentary breakfast items; a sound insulated theater equipped with Netflix, Showtime and an Xbox; a spacious living room with comfortable seating, a record player and a fine selection of vinyl; a dining room that seats 12-16 people; washer and dryer with free detergent/dryer sheets, and a picnic table and firepit in our big backyard which is fenced-in and dog-friendly.

There are often guests socializing with other guests or the staff in the communal areas on the first floor. Many guests enjoy using the living or dining rooms as a pseudo-cafe where they can drink coffee or tea and work on their laptops. We encourage our guests to interact and use the shared spaces as they would their own homes. However, no one will shame you for hanging out in your room. We want everyone to feel safe and comfortable.

The Greenleaf House has become a hub in the Glenwood Avenue Art District of Roger‚Äôs Park, where all flavors of creative artists have lived and collaborated for several decades. The Mile of Murals‚Äîa community-based public art initiative‚Äîbegins half a block from our front door. Within easy walking distance you will find a bustling nightlife, small theaters and music venues, several locally-owned eateries, and Loyola Park, which has a great playground and arguably the best sand beach in the city.

Here are a few links about our neighborhood:

The Greenleaf House is conveniently located near two major public trains‚Äîwe are one block from the El (CTA Red Line at Morse Avenue) and three blocks (5-8 minute walk) from the Roger‚Äôs Park Metra Station. There are several bus stops within walking distance, including express buses to downtown. It is also never difficult to hail a cab, and Uber/Lyft rides generally arrive in 1-5 minutes after placing a request. For your convenience, we have included links to public transit information below. 

CTA Morse Red Line Station:



Metra Rogers Park Station:

Checking out: Check-out time is 12pm noon. Please leave your keys in the door. 

Checking Out late: You may checkout late till 3pm, but must be out of your room by 12pm. Feel free to hang out on the first floor, or stow your luggage and explore. If you would like to stay later than 3pm, we are happy to accommodate you so long as it doesn‚Äôt interfere with a house rental or special event. 

Luggage Storage: There is a storage space in the TV room. It is first come, first serve and has a lock and key. If the key is in the lock, it is free to use. Please use only if your room is unavailable.

Laundry: Feel free to use the laundry any time except 12pm - 3pm. That is when we wash sheets and towels used by our guests. Detergent and dryer sheets are provided. 

Security cameras: For your safety, there are security cameras inside the common areas and outside the property. We don‚Äôt actively monitor them unless something happens. Please do not tamper with the security cameras. 

Shared Space: The first floor is a shared space. This includes the TV room (which has Netflix). Feel free to hang out and interact with other guests. 

Dogs: Dogs are allowed for an extra $10 per night. We accept Venmo, PayPal, cash or check. See the dropbox in the kitchen for further instructions.

100% Smoke Free: Smoking is prohibited inside the house. Please smoke outside. 

Parking: There is a free parking space (first come first serve) behind the black trailer on the property. This spot is on the property. Do not park across the ally or you will get towed. There is free street parking on Greenleaf Ave and on other streets. Always read the signs.

Visitors: Visitors are allowed on the first floor until 11pm.

Quiet Hours: As courtesy to other guests, quiet hours are 11pm to 7am.

description:
Welcome to the ultimate Chicago Experience!

Unbeatable River North location which includes world class dining, nightlife, comedy, shopping, museums, and art.

Our unit is walking distance to the CTA Blue Line (Grand stop) which is a 2 minute ride to the Loop, 20 minute train ride to Midway Airport, and 25 minute train ride to O'Hare. 

This unit includes exposed brick,  a fully furnished kitchen, full size dining table, and plenty of furniture to just relax.

Please feel free to message me via Air bnb or directly via cell phone:  786-301-4903

Street noise can filter into the unit.

access: All parts of house are accessible except for basement utility room.  Also the garage will be locked and not accessible
description:
Stylish house on a large lot with fire pit,  within walking distance to bustling downtown (7 minute walk to CTA + Metra). Complete gut rehab in 2013. Five big bedrooms with 3.5 baths including entire floor for master.  Enjoy a steam shower in the master bath. Modern, bright kitchen, hardwood floors, large family room, fully finished lower level with 5th bedroom and full bath, large laundry room on 2nd floor with laundry chute. Outdoor space includes large front porch and deck off of living room.

Wood fireplaces are not safe to use, please do not use.   We would love if food and drinks could stay in the kitchen and dining area,  our couches and area rugs are newish :)

All parts of house are accessible except for basement utility room.  Also the garage will be locked and not accessible

We will be available to reach via our cell phone.

Oh, the things you can do in downtown Evanston!  Amazing restaurants, beautiful houses to see on your way and only about a  20 min walk to the beach on Lake Michigan (1.1 miles away).  We absolutely love it here, especially in the spring summer and fall!   We moved to this house in the summer of 2018, and it still feels like we're in the "honeymoon" phase, so much to do, the beautiful beaches that feel like you're on the ocean, the parks, the quaint houses,  beautiful trees throughout the town, the bustling downtown, etc etc,  hope you enjoy it as much as us :)

Our home is not wheelchair or ADA accessible.

Free on site parking located right of the garage off of alley as well as free street parking, however please see street parking restrictions for 3rd Tuesday and 3rd Wednesday of the month,  March 1st - December 15.  There are also restrictions during a snowfall greater than 2 inches.  Please see link under "guidebook."

https://www.cityofevanston.org/Home/ShowDocument?id=35809

space: Wood fireplaces are not safe to use, please do not use.   We would love if food and drinks could stay in the kitchen and dining area,  our couches and area rugs are newish :)
summary: Stylish house on a large lot with fire pit,  within walking distance to bustling downtown (7 minute walk to CTA + Metra). Complete gut rehab in 2013. Five big bedrooms with 3.5 baths including entire floor for master.  Enjoy a steam shower in the master bath. Modern, bright kitchen, hardwood floors, large family room, fully finished lower level with 5th bedroom and full bath, large laundry room on 2nd floor with laundry chute. Outdoor space includes large front porch and deck off of living room.

I will be home to welcome the guest. :)

access: Parking, garden and back balcony.
description:
Huge, light drenched, two bedroom, private apartment just moments from the train and 10 minute ride downtown.  Stunning, giant, private garden and free, secure, gated parking.  Vibrant artist community. Plenty of room for everyone. Washer and dryer and easy 24 hour check in.

There is a half acre private gated garden for cooking out, meditation, reading or relaxing.  There is also free, secure, gated parking.

Parking, garden and back balcony.

I'm a phone call away if you forgot your phone charger, need more towels or have any questions at all!

Make no mistake, East Garfield Park is definitely the inner city.  It's filled with beauty and grit! There is a ton of diversity, art and life.  Think SoHo in the 70's.  You can't walk to a coffee shop but you can catch an art opening, eat some real BB-Q, walk the park and actually say hello to a total stranger.  Not a common thing for a big city.  If you're not used to big cities, do a street view to make sure it's in your comfort zone.  Or, step outside of your comfort zone and have a fantastic new experience.  Isn't that one of the best parts of travel!?

5 minute walk to the Kedzie Green Line takes you downtown in 9 minutes.  We're about 35 minutes from either airport.

Your cab/Uber/Lyft driver is going to tell you that the neighborhood stinks... If they do, then you know for sure that they've never been in the neighborhood.  Read the reviews and don't be swayed by their misinformed bias.

THE FOLLOWING RULES ARE STRICT AND NON-NEGOTIABLE 

1. No extra guests beyond what is mentioned during booking. If you have visitors they cannot stay past midnight. A fee of $20 person for extra guests staying past midnight. 
2. Absolutely no parties. Will be asked to leave if found out by the property manager and  a $250 fee will be charged. 
3. No loud music/noise such as would disturb the neighbors 
4. This is a non-smoking property-cigarettes, pipes, marijuana or vaping etc
- will charge $250, no exceptions
5. Clean up and do not leave any dirty dishes in the sink before you checkout. Leave trash in the large kitchen bin. Extra garbage bags are in kitchen cabinet 
6. Turn off lights and AC when you leave the apartment.

access: Guest are welcome to use the entire apartment at their leisure - including patio.
description:
My roommate and I are rarely home, so check out all the available listings. 

This listing is shared, but the apartment is huge, you wouldn't notice us. The 4 bedroom apartment is complete with a patio and office. You would have two private queen rooms, free easy street parking, and a shared bath.

- Damen Blue Line: 20min walk or 14min walk/bus
- Western Blue Line: 18 min walk or 12min walk/bus
- Ogilvie Trans: 17 min drive or 38 min public 
- United Center: 12 min drive or 30 min public

Our apartment has high ceilings and tons of natural light. Nearby public transportation or affordable lyft/uber rides.

Guest are welcome to use the entire apartment at their leisure - including patio.

Technically Humboldt Park neighborhood, but consider ourselves Wicker Park.

Close to Damen and Western blue and buses on North Ave and Division.

I have a dog, Taylor that is sometimes in the apartment. I travel often, so she is away when i'm away. If she is home, Taylor is nice and use to guests checking in.

additional_house_rules:
Additional rules 

All bookings require a security deposit of $475 or more. This deposit will not be charged in advance. 

 Kindly note that the special reduction in Cleaning Fees is only for the Winter Season (1 DEC 2018)hence the regular Cleaning fees of USD 100 will be applicable for all arrivals on or after 01 March, 2019 on wards. 

 For security purposes, we require all guests to provide an ID verification, license, or passport before check-in.  

Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds.  

 Check-in time is any time after 4 P.M-11 PM. Check-out time is any time before 11 a.m. If an earlier check-in or a later check-out time is desired, then you can send us a request. However, this is not guaranteed. 

We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine.   

Our locations do not allow pets.   No parties, gatherings or events of any kind are allowed in the unit. 

  If a location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $75 for every extra hour of cleaning required.   

Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises or its facilities. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises.
Guests recognize that they may personally purchase insurance to protect themselves in such events.  

 If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in full.   We may ask to hold in advance a damage/security deposit for last minute reservations or local stays. 

 If you notice anything that presents a danger that could result in damage to the location or to any individuals, let us know immediately.   

If guests delay the cleaners from beginning their cleaning at the predetermined check-out time, guests will be charged $100. This fee is applied to any late checkout between 11 am and 1 pm. Any guest who is still in the location after 1 pm will be charged for an extra night. This does not apply if our team has approved a late checkout in advance.   

When you make a reservation with us, you are agreeing to all of the above House Rules.  

Shoes off, please.

description:
Treat yourself to a modern getaway in a Cirro 1 Bedroom Suite close to Restaurant Row! Enjoy the luxuries of a 5-star hotel in the comfort of a light, airy apartment in walking distance to some of the city‚Äôs most delicious and exciting hotspots and just a short drive to the McCormick convention center.

The West Loop is a study of contrasts, mixing the bright and chic with the industrial and gritty. With a plethora of new restaurants on Randolph Street and Fulton Market, this location offers stellar cuisine for guests looking to taste Chicago.

Designed with the traveler in mind, this Cirro Suite provides a lavish spread of luxurious amenities in a spacious layout with a modern, worldly flair - all set in front of the beautiful Chicago skyline!

Cirro suites offer a unique experience that caters to tranquility and comfort and are tailored to meet the needs of each visitor. Each bedroom awaits to enfold you with soft, white linens, a memory foam mattress, and plush guest robes. Each bathroom is ready to cleanse you with organic soaps and Turkish cotton towels. The highest of three status levels, Cirro suites gives you the exquisite Chicago experience you deserve.

At a Glance

* Luxury white cotton linens (sheets, robes, towels) 
* Puracy‚Ñ¢ organic bath and body products
* Salon professional-grade hair dryer
* Two 55-inch 4K TV‚Äôs and sound bars (living room and bedroom)
* Fast Internet 
* Amazon Echo
* Electronic safe
* Nespresso coffee maker w/ Nespresso pods
*In walking distance to the best bars and restaurants
*Concierge services available from 9am to 10pm (central)

We can be contacted by phone or via text messaging through the App. 9am-10pm

The West Loop is a study of contrasts, mixing the bright and chic with the industrial and gritty. With a plethora of new restaurants on Randolph Street and Fulton Market, and the French Market just blocks away, this location offers an authentic experience for a guest looking to see and taste the real Windy City!

access:
The bedroom will have a queen size bed, 2 pillows and clean sheets.  The bathroom is not connected, but it is your own to use-towels will be provided.
You're welcome to all areas of the house, my own bedroom excluded.  The deck is especially nice to sit on in the summer, it gets the evening sun:) 

The living room has Amazon Fire stick and Wii, and fast wireless internet is available (I'll be happy to give the password). There is also a wireless printer available for use, if needed.
description:
My condo has new appliances and a large deck to relax on. Easy access to trains/buses/grocery store/coffee, and a few blocks from the lake!.  A variety of restaurants/bars to enjoy nearby. Enjoy your own bedroom and bath. Must be ok with dogs, as I have two! 

The bedroom will have a queen size bed, 2 pillows and clean sheets.  The bathroom is not connected, but it is your own to use-towels will be provided.
You're welcome to all areas of the house, my own bedroom excluded.  The deck is especially nice to sit on in the summer, it gets the evening sun:) 

The living room has Amazon Fire stick and Wii, and fast wireless internet is available (I'll be happy to give the password). There is also a wireless printer available for use, if needed.

I'm working during the day on weekdays, and occasionally on weekends, but I'm usually around in the evenings.  I'm happy to answer any and all questions, give directions and suggestions of what to do in the city!

My 2 dogs are also very friendly and welcoming-a little scratch behind the ears and they're your new best friend:)

The Rogers Park area has been experiencing a lot of growth-from new housing to restaurants and shopping.  There are also a number of "hole in the wall" gems that have been in the area for a long time.  There's a little bit of everything in this area.

Also, if you're staying for an extended time, there is a grocery store within a few minutes walking distance, along with both a Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts on the way to the el station.

The beauty of living in the city is that it's so easy to get around with public transportation!  There is easy access to buses, the "el" subway system, metra, and there are also cabs readily available.  

Transportation to/from the airport and condo: Both airports have an el line stop inside the airport, and can be taken to within a couple blocks of the condo (Howard stop).  There is also a cab line at each airport.  They're more direct and faster, but also more expensive than the el.

I also have a queen size aero bed available, if there is more than 2 people traveling-please contact for the additional pricing info.
house_rules: Smoking is not allowed inside, but is fine on the deck/outdoors.  Must be courteous/friendly to pets. Please clean up after yourself in the kitchen in a timely manner.  Feel free to use the grill, as long as it's cleaned and covered afterwards.
interaction:
I'm working during the day on weekdays, and occasionally on weekends, but I'm usually around in the evenings.  I'm happy to answer any and all questions, give directions and suggestions of what to do in the city!

My 2 dogs are also very friendly and welcoming-a little scratch behind the ears and they're your new best friend:)
neighborhood_overview:
The Rogers Park area has been experiencing a lot of growth-from new housing to restaurants and shopping.  There are also a number of "hole in the wall" gems that have been in the area for a long time.  There's a little bit of everything in this area.

Also, if you're staying for an extended time, there is a grocery store within a few minutes walking distance, along with both a Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts on the way to the el station.
notes: I also have a queen size aero bed available, if there is more than 2 people traveling-please contact for the additional pricing info.
summary: My condo has new appliances and a large deck to relax on. Easy access to trains/buses/grocery store/coffee, and a few blocks from the lake!.  A variety of restaurants/bars to enjoy nearby. Enjoy your own bedroom and bath. Must be ok with dogs, as I have two!
transit:
The beauty of living in the city is that it's so easy to get around with public transportation!  There is easy access to buses, the "el" subway system, metra, and there are also cabs readily available.  

Transportation to/from the airport and condo: Both airports have an el line stop inside the airport, and can be taken to within a couple blocks of the condo (Howard stop).  There is also a cab line at each airport.  They're more direct and faster, but also more expensive than the el.

access: You have exclusive to the entire second floor of the pink house.
description:
Located in a quirky, Victorian era,  pink house on a residential street in the East Village neighborhood, this unit is a charming piece of Old Chicago.

This 2nd story, apartment features an eat in kitchen, a double and a single bedroom, and a front room that oozes Chicago history.

Perfect for a quick weekend getaway or an extended stay. A Walk Score of 97 means you won't need a car to experience the city. Easy access to Division Blue Line, nightlife, shopping & adventure.

Take a step back in time and into a curious home full of art, light and vintage Chicago in this classic workman's Victorian cottage. 

Enter through the landscaped courtyard at the back of the building and up the outdoor staircase. 

The eat in kitchen comes equipped with everything we think you'll need including a microwave, antique farmhouse sink, apartment sized stove, full size fridge, and cooking utensils. 

Separated from the kitchen by curtains  is the master bedroom. You'll get a great night's sleep with  a queen size bed with a Sterns and Foster mattress and high quality natural fiber bedding. You'll also enjoy the vintage vanity (hello gorgeous!)  and rack for your clothing. 

The front room has a plush leather couch, live plants, obscenely large smart TV with Netflix and Hulu, vintage turntable and records, and a quintessential Chicago neighborhood view. 

The bathroom could be in a historical museum exhibit. It was installed so long ago that every pipe is visible (con) but contains a big gold glitter clawfoot bathtub (pro). Consider it an experience. 

The second bedroom is lovingly referred to as "The Cozy Room" it contains one plush twin size daybed with a mountain of pillows, an antique dresser and a rad, mod lamp, and a cherub chandelier. Thats it, because that is all it can hold. This room is small, mighty and separated from the main living space with curtains. 

Have you ever wondered what buildings looked like in Wicker Park before they were torn down and new condos were erected? This is your chance to live it. The floors aren't level, the walls are made of plaster, the windows are older than your grandparents. In no way is this an "All Mod Cons" apartment, but it is chock full of character, history and love. 

As a antique and vintage dealer for nearly 3 decades, some of the art and furniture may change occasionally and I'll do my best to update the pictures accordingly. If there is a particular piece you're interested in, there is a fair shot of brining it home as a souvenir. If you ask nicely for a list of secret-awesome-thrift stores, you might get a tip.

You have exclusive to the entire second floor of the pink house.

My family lives on the property and you'll be able to see as little or as much of us as you'd like. The garden and yard is shared with 2 other units so there is a good chance you'll meet some neighbors as well!

The East Village neighborhood is packed with restaurants, bars, nightlife, independent shopping, and corporate necessities like Target, Walgreens and Starbucks.  All of these businesses are less than a 10 minute walk away. 

Its easy to take a quick stroll, and stop by Hoosier Mama Bakery, Forbidden Root Brewery, Yuzu Sushi, Do√±a Naty's Mexican Restaurant, and get a look at the famous Shit Fountain, without getting anywhere near that day's step goal.

Getting into the heart of bustling Wicker Park aka The Crotch, is a lovely walk away.

You are a 4 minute walk to the Chicago Ave bus which will take you down to Navy Pier, a 10 minute walk to the Division Street Blue Line Stop, and 2 minutes to the Ashland Bus. 

Walk Score: 97 
Transit Score: 75
Bike Score: 90

A car is not required to navigate the city from this unit but  if you have one, non-zoned street parking is not hard to find.

Window unit air conditioners are installed in summer months (not pictured).

description:
Brand new luxury home located blocks from Wrigley Field. The property‚Äôs open floor plan is the ideal setting to entertain with friends and family. The house include high end finishes in the kitchen, outdoor space to BBQ and  entertain groups of all sizes, a large basement (wet bar, air hockey table, Pop N Shot Basketball Hoop), TV/Fireplace entertainment center, and many other features. The house is large enough where all guests can find privacy in the bedroom areas. 

.

You are located in the Lakeview/Southport Corridor neighborhood next to some of the best restaurants, entertainment, and shopping in Chicago. If you are looking to enjoy some fun on the lake you are only a walk or short bike ride away to Belmont Harbor and Lake Shore Drive. You can also get to downtown in 10-15 minutes via uber/cab or take the brown line train which is an approximate 5 minute walk from the house. This property is for those looking to live like a local in a classic Chicago style Bungalow with modern finishes. Let me know if you have any questions about the house or Chicago in general. I am a Cubs season ticket holders and Chicago resident for 32 years. It is a great city with a ton to offer. Go Cubs!

access: The entrance is the front door of the house with a keypad code. The layout makes it easy and safe to come and go with out disrupting any one.  The room is large but cozy with three windows. The bathroom is semi private.
description:
Large room in a tree lined street in a hip neighboorhod

This is a large room in a quiet vintage house on a tree lined street in one of the hottest neighbor hoods in Chicago. The room is very comfortable and cozy it includes three window that face a maple tree, table/desk, single bed,  and shared, though rarely,  bath. It is decorated with original artwork, exhibit posters and vintage photos from the neighborhood. Outside the room, for your use, there is a galley kitchenette with a  mini fridge, toaster oven, microwave and coffee machine.  If you prefer with stainless steel and granite, this is not a good fit for you. This rental is for the room only, not the rest of the house. No pets please. Street parking is free and it is a 5 minute walk to the Fullerton bus and 10 minute walk to the Western blue line.

The entrance is the front door of the house with a keypad code. The layout makes it easy and safe to come and go with out disrupting any one.  The room is large but cozy with three windows. The bathroom is semi private.

I work full time so you might not see me much. If I am home in the evening I sometime watch tv, and the sound seems to travel very well. To be considerate to my guest I do not watch it past 10.

The neighborhood  is  quiet and residential yet close to all the fun and lively new entertainment in the city. It is on the north west end of Bucktown close to Logan Square and Wicker Park.

The blue line is a few blocks away, it gets you downtown in an few minutes and to O'Hare Airport in about 20 minutes.  The Fullerton bus is two blocks away and get to the the red line in a few minutes. Parking is non permitted and there is always street parking close by.

This opportunity is good for long term, students or work.

 I'm sorry but I can't help with holding personal belongings/luggages after check out time for security reason because I have next guests checking in the place. ( if your flight is late at evening and u have no place leaving lugudge please always book an extra day or late check out if possible I can do for extra charge ) 

lost keys is $100 fee 
Lock out $80 for coming out

DAMAGE TO ROOM:  Damage to rooms, fixtures, furnishing and equipment including the removal of electronic equipment, towels, art work, etc. will be charge at 120% of full and new replacement value plus any shipping and handling charges. Any damage to the property, whether accidental or willful, is the responsibility of the registered guest .  Any costs associated with repairs and/or replacement will be charged thru Airbnb,   In extreme cases, criminal charges will be pursued.
 
DAMAGE TO MATTRESSES AND BEDDING:
Damage to mattresses and linen including; towels, mattress pads, sheets, bedspreads, blankets resulting from the use of body oils, make-up, shoe-polish, etc. will result in a charge for the special cleaning, repair or replacement of the damaged article.
 
Complimentary Access to My guest: 
(  items subject to change at anytime without further notice )

WiFi internet 
Elevator in the building 
Cable or Local TV channels/DVD
Coffee /Tea or other items in the Unit.
interaction:
Please first READ House rules!
Please contact me on AIRBNB website only, its easier to know who's texting me and i can look you up faster and know our previous conversations.
neighborhood_overview:
Saturday morning its farmers market so the streets will be closed and u can shop fresh veggies and fruit right next to your building.
I love that is everything is walking distance,from coffee shops,restaurants, designer stores,few clubs. Melenium park 9 min drive/ 30 min walk,Lincoln park zoo 7 min drive/20 min walk.North ave beach 10-15 min walk
notes:
Please don't talk to anyone about airbnb, walk to the place like u own it. If anyone asks you where u going or who u are , YOU just visiting ur friend and u don't have to unswear to anyone because of a large theft of pakages in a building resident's aftraid if stranger's coming in and out the building please make them feel safe.
It's a City and its always loud here so please bring ear plugs to sleep.

Pricing is set based on location,season and demand.....not how big or small the places is or amenities, they can change and varying all the time,there is no refund for that or cancelling resarvation after checking in.
space:
Please first READ House rules !!!!!
Building is antique build in 1890,  with elevator ,pets are welcome in a building. Window Air-condition , queen bed, couch that folds down and tv with local athena channels only.


If parking needed use app Spothero to find near by parking or public parking garage.

Please bring ear plugs due to your will be staying im a city ,there always noise outside cars,cops,people,construction,farmers market or other stuff.might be hoing on . I AM NOT RESPONSIBLE ANYTHING GOING OM OUTSODE MY UNIT AND NO REFUND WILL BE ISSUED NO ANY NOISE OR OTHER THINGS GOING ON OUTSIDE, this is not resort its biggest and busiest city in USA.
summary: Vintage in a heart of Gold Coast studio.Features hardwood floors, open kitchen, bathroom, closet/storage space,in a building laundry,elevator, pets welcome and more! Walking distance to shopping, night life,restaurants and much more.At night sometimes gets loud please bring ear plugs if u sleep light.
transit:
Taxis are always driving around,busses, uber,lift, Red line CTA train station few blocks away too.
UBER:
This is a personal-driver service that is approx 20% cheaper than a taxi. It's an easy-to-download app where you can enter the pick-up address and a driver will pick you up in 10 mins or less. I personally use it all the time and have never had any issues.

description:
The sophisticated design of the St. Jane King is spacious with lofted ceilings and beautiful crown molding.  The St. Jane King features a seating area near expansive windows, creating an inviting urban retreat in the heart of Chicago. Amenities include: LED SMART TV, premium grade linens, 24/7 fitness center, high speed wifi, and in-room Nespresso machine. Please note that there is a daily service fee of $23.08 that will be collected upon check-in by the hotel.

The d√©cor pays homage to the building‚Äôs heritage while pushing it to a new, more modern place. Refined elegance abounds, starring high ceilings, unique crown molding, aged brass light fixtures and marble countertops ‚Äì plus thoughtful touches like a locally-sourced mini-bar and artwork.      

The property offers:
'Free Reign' Bar/Restaurant
Room service
Concierge team
Access to fitness center

24 hour reception with concierge.

Located in the heart of Chicago, steps away from all the popular landmarks Chicago has to offer.

additional_house_rules:
‚Ä¢ Check-in is available after 3 pm. You will pick up your keys from the onsite guest service team upon arrival.

If you‚Äôre planning to arrive after 10pm, please call the reception at 1-630-9539393 so that you‚Äôre not marked as a no-show in their system.

No shows on the day of arrival: If you do not check-in on your specified arrival date, and we have not received written notice of your late arrival or cancellation, then you will be marked as a no-show and your reservation will be cancelled (please note that the standard cancellation policy will apply).
‚Ä¢ Check-out time is before 12 pm. Please return your keys to the onsite guest services team.
‚Ä¢ There is a light cleaning service provided every few days.
‚Ä¢ Guests must be a minimum age of 21 years in order to make a reservation, and must occupy the unit for the duration of the stay. You will be asked to provide photo identification upon check-in. Any reservation made under false pretenses will forfeit all payments, and guests will be escorted from the property.

description:
Only a short trip from the heart of Chicago, this is your perfect home away from home. Enjoy complimentary breakfast every morning, and then take the free weekday shuttle within 5 miles of your suite. We can't wait to host you in our space, which features:

‚Ä¢ 1 Bedroom with 1 King bed
‚Ä¢ Sleeper sofa in the living area for additional guests
‚Ä¢ On-site washer and dryer
‚Ä¢ In-house dry-cleaning service
‚Ä¢ Air-conditioned living space
‚Ä¢ Cable television
‚Ä¢ DVD player
‚Ä¢ Complimentary breakfast buffet with delicious options
‚Ä¢ Access to the business center
‚Ä¢ Fitness center on-site
‚Ä¢ Housekeeping service every few days
‚Ä¢ On-site guest service team
‚Ä¢ Free parking available on-site

Convenience meets comfort in this equipped suite that offers you free shuttle access on week days and daily complimentary breakfast! Just a 20-minute drive from the Brookfield Zoo, 2 miles from the prestigious outdoor shopping destination, Oakbrook Center, and 10 miles from the Morton Arboretum in West Chicago that includes a unique Maze Garden, this is a great location for those travelling for fun or for business. 

There is 1 BEDROOM that features 1 King bed. There's a sleeper sofa in the living area for additional guests.

Get ready in our 1 BATHROOM. We provide you with a hairdryer, towels, and complimentary toiletries. There are self-serve washing and drying machines available on-site. Same-day dry cleaning services are available.

Retreat to our air-conditioned LIVING SPACE. Curl up and enjoy your favorite shows on our flatscreen TV or watch your favorite movie with our DVD player. You can easily connect with friends and family back home, courtesy of the complimentary Wi-Fi. Get some work done while you're away by taking advantage of the laptop-friendly space.

In the KITCHEN you'll find a stove, a microwave, a dishwasher, a refrigerator, cooking utensils, and dishes. You can enjoy all of your meals in the dining area.  Start your morning with a cup of coffee, fresh from our in-suite coffee machine. In the morning, enjoy a complimentary breakfast buffet which features a variety of delicious options.

There are a number of other amenities you're sure to enjoy when you stay at Staybridge Sb Chicago-Oakbrook Terrace Il where our space is conveniently located. These include use of the business center, fitness center access, meeting facilities, housekeeping services, evening receptions for guests with food and drink, and more! Guest services are available on-site to ensure a stress-free stay.

If you're traveling by car, there is free parking available on-site.

A number of these units are available, and each is individually decorated. The images shown are a representation of the unit you will receive. At check-in, you will receive a unit of the same type as shown in this listing, complete with the advertised size and number of rooms, but the actual decor in the unit, view, and furniture layout may differ. You will have access to all amenities advertised!

A damage deposit will be processed as a pre-authorization on your credit card and will be released after your departure provided there is no damage, items missing, or extra cleaning required.

LOCAL FAVORITES
Your suite is just a 20-minute drive from the Brookfield Zoo that features exotic animals and a beautiful butterfly garden. Experience in-door skydiving at i-Fly in Naperville, also a 20-minute drive away. You can arrange for complimentary shuttle service to the Downers Grove train station (must be coordinated with front desk at hotel). The train will take you directly into the city where you can see the famous sights like Navy Pier!

At check-in, you will receive a unit of the same type as shown in this listing, complete with the advertised size and number of rooms, but the actual decor in the unit, view, and furniture layout may differ. access: You have access to the entire studio, second floor porch and yard but please note that the yard and porch are shared spaces that our tenants and ourselves use so keep them clean.
description:
A private second floor vintage studio apartment right in the heart of Logan Square. Located just half a block north of the picturesque Logan Boulevard and two blocks away (5-8 minute walk) from the Logan Square blue line stop which is great for getting around the city. Logan Square is a 15 minute train ride into the loop and 20 minutes out to O'Hare. This studio is convenient for the weary O'Hare traveler or perfect for a private getaway from the hustle of Chicago.

The space is a quiet two room studio with a kitchen which includes a sink, stove/oven, fridge, and coffee/tea. There is a table and two chairs so that you can sit and eat or relax as needed. 

The main living area has a full size bed, nightstand, air conditioner, and side tables with a lamp. We also have curtains that can provide privacy as needed. 

You will also have access to the porch and yard during your stay which is perfect for relaxing after a long day of adventures in the city.

You have access to the entire studio, second floor porch and yard but please note that the yard and porch are shared spaces that our tenants and ourselves use so keep them clean.

We live in the building (first floor) and are available if you need us. We also love providing recommendations of things to do in Chicago so please just ask!

Logan Square is a very popular neighborhood that is full of bars, amazing restaurants, beautiful boulevard parks, and located right off the Blue Line which makes getting around the city a breeze. During the summer the sidewalks are filled with outdoor dining at local restaurants, the historic boulevard is perfect for runs or relaxing walks, and the Logan Square Farmers market on Sunday mornings is a must do.

Parking is easy to find on our street and the surrounding non-permit streets. 

If you want to bike around the city, there is a Divvy bike rental dock two blocks away at Diversey and Richmond.

The blue line train is a 5-8 minute walk from our place and perfect for getting into the loop or going to other neighborhoods close by. There are also buses on all major streets that run in both directions.

Our building is heated using radiators which means that the thermostat is located in our apartment. We keep the temperature at the required level but realize it may be a bit chilly or a bit too warm for some, if you need any heat adjustment please ask us and we will adjust as needed.
house_rules: - We prefer guests honor quiet hours starting 10pm and midnight on the weekends. This way we are able to continue to respect our neighbors and immediate surroundings.

access:

Please, note: there's no outlet in the bathroom
description:
With a Walk Score of 99, you have the best of Chicago. This AIR-CONDITIONED STUDIO is ideally located by the Clark/Broadway/Diversey intersection, just 6 minutes walking to Lincoln Park and Lake Michigan, blocks away from Boystown and Wrigley Field

With easy access, this space is perfect if you are catching a Cubs game or in town for business

Towels and toiletries will be left according to the number of guests BOOKED. Extra fees will apply. We charge $49 per extra guest per night

This STUDIO has a full-sized bed (and one twin-sized air-mattress) and a shared back deck with outdoor furniture

Smart TV with DirecTV Now (live stream of HBO, CNN, Bravo, Comedy Central and more), Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime Video

It accommodates up to 3 guests. Towels and toiletries will be included according to number of guests BOOKED. Extra fees apply to extra guests

Besides your full-sized bed and one twin-sized air-mattress... kitchen, bathroom with bathtub, deck with portable charcoal grill (easy to take to the lake). Large walk-in closet. Washer and dryer in premises

Please, note: there's no outlet in the bathroom

We like in-person check-in but self-check-in and full privacy are offered

You will receive a link with check-in instructions within 24 hours of your check-in. If you have a U.S. mobile number, you will also receive a text about your check-in

FULL DISCLOSURE: If you haven‚Äôt used or don‚Äôt know how to use a lockbox, self-check-in is not for you. Your check-in should be in-person and between 11AM and 2:30PM. Absolutely no exceptions

Lincoln Park/Lakeview is home to two of the most vibrant sports, nightlife, and theater scenes in Chicago: Wrigleyville and Boystown. Explore souvenir shops and casual eateries by day, and hop from bar to bar along Clark, Addison, Sheffield, and Lincoln Avenues by night. North Lincoln Avenue also features concert venues such as Lincoln Hall. The revered Steppenwolf Theatre Company is on Halstead Street. Comedy clubs Up and Second City sit on the border with Old Town. Within the shoreline park are North Avenue Beach and the Chicago History Museum

You walk to Trader Joe's (feet away), LA Fitness, Fitness 19, Walgreens, CVS, LPAC, bars, restaurants within 60 seconds. Close to multiple buses and the Diversey Brown/Purple line. Just a 6-minutes walk to the lake and 8-minutes walk to Boystown/Wrigley Field. Grab a train to downtown in 15 minutes

Unit is on the 3rd floor and there's no elevator. Also there's no outlet in the bathroom (there's an extension cord and a mirror by your bed)

We have free street parking permits in the unit. You are responsible for finding a spot (383 zone ONLY), parking, and filling up the permit. You are also responsible for paying any tickets resulted from failing to properly filing up the permit or failing to read street signs

additional_house_rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises unless you are in a designated smoking area. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence.  Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per key fee.

access: You will have complete and private access to our condo.
description:
Our junior one bedroom condo in Wrigleyville is a sophisticated Cubs clubhouse - decorated with historical photos and comfortable, modern furniture, you'll want to call this place home whether you're in town for a game, business, or just seeing all that Chicago has to offer. We're a quick walk to the beach, a half hour to the Loop on the Red line, and in one of the most dynamic neighborhoods in the city. Book today!

Our condo is open to take advantage of the second-floor light and fantastic Wrigley views! You enter into the kitchen, which is fully equipped (including dishwasher), which is open to the living room with convertible sofa. Our bedroom nook has a privacy wall to the common areas, but faces the sliding glass doors.

You will have complete and private access to our condo.

Wrigleyville is the lively little pocket in the Lakeview neighborhood that sits in the shadows of historic Wrigley Field, the second oldest stadium in baseball and home to the beloved Chicago Cubs. It has become a magnet for sports fans and young professionals alike, and particularly singles who hop from bar to bar along Clark, Addison and Sheffield Avenues.

We're under a 10 minute walk to the Addison red line stop, and steps to the Clark bus line.

access:
Guests will have access to use the entire unit for their exclusive use. You also have the convenience of the following parking options available for your vehicles:
- dedicated rear parking is available for lease off-alley lot behind the building for $15/day
- Chicago street parking meters on Milwaukee Ave (use ParkChicago from App Store to pay electronically)
- Free street parking on surrounding neighborhood streets

Please note that this building is fully occupied and common areas are shared with neighbors and separate units, so please restrict unnecessary use of the common areas, and store items only within your unit.
description:
Feel as if you are living in, and experiencing the city life when you are looking out of the bay windows of this beautiful graystone - next to Bloomingdale 606 Trail, North Ave Beach, and within walking distance to plenty of vibrant restaurants, retail, and nightlife in Wicker Park / Bucktown / Logan Square neighborhoods. 

This location boasts a 96 WalkScore and provides easy access to the city via cab, public transit, or bike. Space can be made instantly available, so book today!

Recently renovated 2BD w/ Central HVAC on the top floor of this vintage 19th century graystone, that can sleep and entertain up to 7 guests w/ truly separate living & dining areas:
- large bedroom (sleeps 2, full bed)
- small bedroom (sleeps 1, twin bed)
- pull-out sofa couch (sleeps 2)
- air bed (sleeps 2) provided for guest counts beyond 5

Bathroom features a removable shower head and an intricate vanity. Both bedrooms have built-in California closets to fit a large wardrobe, especially useful for our longer-term guests (discounts offered for weekly,  biweekly monthly, or even month-to-month stays).

Updated kitchen features:
- stainless steel appliances
- plenty of cherry cabinets w/ dishes and utensils
- granite countertops
- in-unit combo washer/dryer combo unit
We provide our guests with reasonable living accommodations, laundry products and toiletries for your use, and on occasion we try to stock the fridge with a few soft beverages.

Guests will have access to use the entire unit for their exclusive use. You also have the convenience of the following parking options available for your vehicles:
- dedicated rear parking is available for lease off-alley lot behind the building for $15/day
- Chicago street parking meters on Milwaukee Ave (use ParkChicago from App Store to pay electronically)
- Free street parking on surrounding neighborhood streets

Please note that this building is fully occupied and common areas are shared with neighbors and separate units, so please restrict unnecessary use of the common areas, and store items only within your unit.

The space is available year-round and we aim to accommodate all bookings with as early or late notice possible. Guests may self check-in to the unit via lockbox access; we can be flexible on check-in times, but check-out times are fixed at noon each day (to accommodate cleaning)

Prestigious Wicker Park / Bucktown / Logan Square neighborhoods right outside your door, a cute neighborhood park right outside your building, and next to the Bloomingdale 606 Trail!

You're right between TWO different six corner intersections with amazing chef-inspired restaurants w/n walking distance. Here are a few to name:
- Serai
- Wasabi
- 90 Mile
- Cuban Cafe
- Big Star
- Small Cheval

Also plenty of nightlife options, sports bars & cocktail bars:
- Violet Hour
- Robey
- Remedy
- Emporium
- Northside Bar & Grill
- Fat Pour

There is a drone video of the building and the nearby area and neighborhood on YouTube by searching for "Hansen Realty".

This location boasts a 96 WalkScore, easily accessible right off of the highway I-90/94.

Plenty of public transit options right outside your doorstep:
CTA Train - Western Blue Line (2 blocks away!)
CTA Bus - #56 Milwaukee #49/X49 Western #72 North #73 Armitage

Neighborhood is very walker-friendly, with everything you could want nearby - even an Aldi grocery store right down the block!

No pets; depending on breed may be considered with a deposit, please contact host to inquire.

additional_house_rules:
Please respect my home as you would yours, your friends and hotels.
1) No smoking allowed inside, feel free to smoke outside on the large balcony.
2) Feel free to cook food you have purchased and use the drink/cookware. Please put in dishwasher once you are done. I turn it on at night and unload in the morning.
3) No pets
4) No additional guests please.
5) Moderate drinking is allowed
6) Quiet hours are between 11pm and 8am

Dishwasher

In unit front loading washer and dryer for guest use for free
description:
Close to public transportation - green line and two buses -#29 state street and #3 Michigan ave. Easy access to McCormick Place for conferences or downtown festivals. Rare find with own room and private bathroom

Message me now as I respond immediately. Instant book is off as my work schedule changes dramatically and this my ability to clean room and host. Generally if dates are open, you request to book, it is accepted within 5 mins.

Easy access to downtown, Hyde Park, White Sox Stadium, Solider Field, Lake Michigan beaches, McCormick Place, Museum Campus, Chinatown, Bridgeport and Pilsen to name a few Chicago Neighborhoods and sights.

The spacious room features a pillow top queen size bed with bed rails and an headboard, that can comfortably accommodate one or two guests. There is also an ottoman in the room for sitting and relaxing. There is also a closet in the room and plenty of space to move around. You will not feel cluttered at all.

A full bathroom with a bathtub is directly across the hallway from the room. This bathroom is not shared with anyone else as it is only used by the visiting guests.

FREE High speed internet is accessible throughout the entire condo where you can stream all of you favorite shows. 

The unit is within a 3rd floor walk up in a historic 1900‚Äôs brick building. You are a 5 min walk to the green line train stop where you can easily access Midway or Ohare buses. Also a 5 min walk to #3 King Drive or #29 State Street buses.

Plenty of FREE street parking for those that are driving. Lyft and Uber also are great options to get around. 2-4 min wait for either service.

Guests will have access to the room, living room and kitchen. 

Kitchen includes:
Gas Stove
Filtered Water through the refrigerator
Dishwasher
Microwave
Pots/Pans
Eating and Cooking Utensils

In unit front loading washer and dryer for guest use for free

I will be staying in another room within the apt. Interaction will be limited as I may be traveling or gone most of the day enjoying summertime Chi.  I will always be accessible by iMessage/WhatsApp or GroupMe to assist with dinner, sight seeing, shopping, etc. recommendation

Historic bronzeville where Soul Food and famous Harold's Chicken is around the corner and fine dinning is a 15/20 min train ride or a 5/10 minute drive. Within the neighborhood you will find several pieces of street art and bike/run lanes.

Getting around from my place is easy. I take the CTA/Uber/Lyft to and from work everyday. Its convenient and cheap.

Getting Around:
There is plenty of FREE street parking available. No parking permit is required and you don't have to worry about moving a car for street cleaning. 

Easy Access to Public transportation:
5 minute walk from CTA Greenline - 47th street stop
#3/#29/#43/#47 CTA Bus stops are within 3 blocks away
Downtown by bus: 25 - minute ride 
Downtown by train: 15- minute ride

Interstate Highways: 
I-55 less than 5-minutes away 
I-90/94 less than 2-minutes away 
I-290 less than 8-minutes away 
Lake Shore Drive 5-minutes away

Uber/Lyft generally picks up within 5 minutes or less.

Airports: 
Midway Airport 15-20 minutes away depending on traffic 
O‚ÄôHare Airport 40-50 minutes away depending on traffic

The condo is on the third floor and an easy walk up. The stairs are wide and carpeted.

Check In is after 2pm and Check out is before 11am.

access: You have access to the whole home!
description:
Hi! Welcome to our newly renovated 3-bed, 2 bath apartment. 

Guests love our home because it is equipped with all of the latest technology, but still has the classic Chicago charm. The home has stainless steel appliances, quartz countertops, Nest thermostat, & in-unit washer/dryer.

Guests enjoy the beach, Wrigleyville, with its' many restaurants, bars, shops. There is also large common outdoor space on the ground level for guests to enjoy.

Walk into our home and you are welcome to a spacious, newly renovated Chicago charmer.

FAQs
Q: Is the neighborhood safe?
A: Very much so. 24 hours a day.

Q: PARKING?
A: Your reservation comes with one spot in the lot next door to the building. If a spot is not available when you arrive, you can use SpotAngels to find a temporary spot until a spot opens up for you :)

Q: Do I need to bring towels, a hair dryer, or linens?
A: Nope! we provide all these things. Same with hotel-size toiletries (unless I happen to be out, which is rare).

Q: When can I check in or check out? 
A: Check in is 4pm and check out is 10am. Early check ins can be difficult if there are guests who checked out same day. We ask for an early check-in, or a late-check out fee, if you request either.

Q: Can I come and go as I please?
A: Yes. And we wouldn't trust any listing with which this isn't the case.

Q: Is the place professionally cleaned between guests?
A: Yes, and we take pride in providing a clean home for guests.

Q: What's my total booking price? 
A: We honestly have no idea. With fees included, it only shows the guest how much they pay. This figure should be present after you enter your dates. Note that, pricing varies on a daily basis, and it actually uses some crazy algorithm to adjust it automatically, so I don't actually control this.

Q: Are the beds comfortable?
A: Very. Some guests say they're the best they've ever slept on!

You have access to the whole home!

You have access to the whole home!

Wrigleyville is a Cubs loving neighborhood filled with tons of amazing restaurants and bars!

Public transportation is very close and the Chicago "L" train can take you right into the city. The Belmont station is located on Belmont and Sheffield.

No local guests
Quiet hours 10pm - 8am
$500 smoking/party fee

additional_house_rules:
PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENT: For the love of all that is good and holy, please take off makeup using tissue, not using white embroidered hand towels. Thank you!

Pets and smoking aren't allowed in the building. No outside guests. Please don't steal my food or my anything else. You should generally just behave how you'd like a guest in your house to behave. I work from home, so I prefer if guests don't make a huge amount of noise in the common area from 9-5. Also, I never thought I'd need to say this, but I have had people go through my drawers looking for things or just exploring.  If you'd like something, please just ask! I'd be happy to find it for you if I have it.

access: There's a dishwasher, W/D, high speed wifi, and unlimited free street parking.
description:
I'm Airbnbing a bedroom in my new construction, modern aesthetic apartment. It has a queen bed and a fancy white and glass bathroom. You can use the WD too!

*Scroll down to map to intersection! G00g1e maps public transit for distances to the sights!

There's a private bath and bedroom across the hall. It's on the ground level, so it's handicap accessible as well as so convenient. Not a single step to enter the apartment!

There's a dishwasher, W/D, high speed wifi, and unlimited free street parking.

I will usually be around to help you get in and make sure you get settled and happy. I work from home, so I'll be here to make sure you have what you need. 

I do travel occasionally, so if I'm not home and you need info on how to get to the house or how to enter, check out the house manual section that will be available to view after you book.

There's a strong Latino presence here so you can get really amazing tacos as well as this thing I discovered called "coctel de frutas". It's just a fruit salad, but with chili lime powder on top.  You wouldn't think it'd be that amazing from the description, but trust me, it's to DIE for! In addition, the neighborhood is historically Polish, so there are still many remaining Polish businesses including some really scrumptious restaurants just a few block down the road.

The Milwaukee bus picks up right outside the door and the Belmont and Addison Blue Line stops are about 3/4 of a mile from here.

The neighborhood is incredibly quiet and peaceful. You'll sleep like a baby.

access: Access includes the living room and a bathroom on the 1st floor only.
description:
Close to downtown and public transportation both the Metra and the CTA Blue Line. You can sleep on our sofa. Our living room is an open floor plan and shared space with room for up to four friends to sleep over with shared bathroom/shower access. This is a common area, open, but not private, on a peaceful, quiet street with free parking.  A hundred feet from a family park and walking distance to Lou Malnati's Pizzeria one of the best pizzas in Chicagoland.

Open floor plan has a sofa with 4 recliners.

Access includes the living room and a bathroom on the 1st floor only.

We are happy to help answer any questions about the area that we can.

The neighborhood is close to downtown Chicago and less than 20 minutes from O'Hare Airport. It is a peaceful family oriented neighborhood with a park a hundred feet away.

Public Transportation is available from 3 different directions and within walking distance.

This is a common area for up to 4 guests.

access: Enjoy a quiet, peaceful stay inside and out with large front porch and gardens to enjoy.  Take in the history of La Grange with walks in the neighborhood full of historic Victorian homes and thriving downtown shops and restaurants
description:
Experience Victorian Charm in this restored home built in 1888.  Spacious, fully furnished guest suite has separate entrance to private room/bath.  
Everything you need for a comfortable stay -all inclusive, utilities, cable, internet, table and chairs, full size bed, mini fridge, microwave,  flat screen TV,  housekeeping/linens, off street parking.   Non smoking building, no pets. The perfect home away from home for business professional, traveler or person in transition

Keyless entrance with security code.

Enjoy a quiet, peaceful stay inside and out with large front porch and gardens to enjoy.  Take in the history of La Grange with walks in the neighborhood full of historic Victorian homes and thriving downtown shops and restaurants

The host is happy and available to answer any questions or recommend places for laundry, dry cleaning, etc

Short walk to thriving downtown La Grange.  Enjoy movie theater, library, shops, restaurants and entertainment.  Two blocks from Metra train station, 18 min express to union station.

Off street parking included, easy access to train or bus

Walk to metra train LG road station (17 min express to Union Station) Conveniently located to great restaurants, shopping, library, churches, major expressways and airports.

description:
If you like a unique vibe, good energy, cool experience, eat or learn how to make Sushi or European food, wine, smoothies, fun activities, and tours or just relax in the front of the tv our home is for you! 

If you like someone to cook for you during your stay breakfast, lunch or dinner or take cooking/language classes also available. ¬†For families with kids, we offer babysitter options inside of your apartment you will stay.¬† All our locks to apartments and rooms are digital so you would not need to worry about security & keys.

Property professionally managed by Ran Fridman - Airbnb Superhost with more than 15 years of experience in the Hospitality Industry worldwide. ¬†We take care of each guest like Family, come and experience our hospitality. 

Thank You and we're looking forward to hosting you, my friend,¬†

Fridman Properties Family

This listing is a perfect option for big groups, families, students, organize events and family gatherings it comes with Jacuzzi hot tub.  This listing for 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 1 living rooms, 1 kitchen and can accommodate up to 8 people.  

Sleeping arrangements are 1 queen size bed,  6 individual beds ( bunk beds ),  sofa bed and rest are air mattresses. Please note smoking allowed on the porch or outside NOT inside of the apartment. 

We offer everything, from cellphone chargers, washer and dryer, printers, hairdryers, umbrellas, irons, and all the necessary toiletries, including even makeup removal.  Indoor pool and gym available two blocks away from local YMCA community center. 

Come and enjoy our hospitality & see why our guests keep coming back. 

Fridman Properties

We're always here to help you with our trip.

Once you confirm your reservation you will receive a link to Guest Portal where we will provide local guidebooks offering suggestions on "where to eat, where to go, what to see, and schedules for upcoming events."

1 block to Metra station - 12 minutes to McCormick Place - stop by Metra.   Also, we can help you with transfers from and to the airport.  We can also drive you around the city.  

We provide transportation from the airport for your safety and convenience for only $69.00 and someone will even meet and greet you at the airport baggage area to help you carry your bags.  We want you to fully enjoy your stay with us, worry free.
