access: You'll have full access to my 4 bedroom, 2 bath home, and shared access to the laundry room and backyard.
description:
*SPECIAL* Dec-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

My apartment is classic Chicago: when you walk in, you'll notice the stunning architectural details, like archways & bay windows, met with updated amenities in the bathrooms & kitchen. Having the bedrooms & bathrooms spread out over 2 floors makes it perfect for traveling with family or colleagues, & since it's just 10 minutes on a bus (or a half-hour walk!) to Wrigley Field, it's a great place to stay to see a game.

The dining room and living room are in the front, on the main floor. There's a full bath, and a Queen-sized bedroom along the hallway, leading to the kitchen that's at the rear of the main floor. On the lower level, there are 3 bedrooms, each with Queen-sized beds, and another full bath. A common laundry room is through the rear lower-level door.

You'll have full access to my 4 bedroom, 2 bath home, and shared access to the laundry room and backyard.

If you have any questions, please reach out via the app or platform for quickest response!

Tucked on Chicago's North Side between North Center and Lakeview, the little pocket that is Roscoe Village is a collection of laid-back taverns, destination brunch restaurants and cozy cafes that all seem to have pretty sidewalk patios and friendly beer gardens during the warm weather months, and a sense of neighborly camraderie during the winter months. Dining ranges from traditional comfort food to Turkish, burgers to bakeries, Cuban to creamy custards ‚Äî all serving up casual hospitality.

The Addison Brown Line stop is about a half-mile / 7 minute walk due east - easily accessible on the 152/Addison bus, which has a stop heading east pretty much across the street! The 49/Wester bus is nearby too, so it's easy to get around here without a car. If you do bring a car, however, there's plenty of street parking in the neighborhood.

In addition to easy access to and from Wrigley Field, we're  also close to music venues like the Beat Kitchen, the Metro, and the Vic Theatre, and conveniently located near the Southport Corridor, including the Music Box Theatre. It's a 10 minute drive to DePaul, 12 minutes to Belmont Harbor and the beach, and 15 minutes to Lincoln Park Zoo. And, since we're just east of the up-and-coming Avondale neighborhood, you'll find plenty of innovative restaurants and bars.

space: The dining room and living room are in the front, on the main floor. There's a full bath, and a Queen-sized bedroom along the hallway, leading to the kitchen that's at the rear of the main floor. On the lower level, there are 3 bedrooms, each with Queen-sized beds, and another full bath. A common laundry room is through the rear lower-level door.
summary:
*SPECIAL* Dec-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

My apartment is classic Chicago: when you walk in, you'll notice the stunning architectural details, like archways & bay windows, met with updated amenities in the bathrooms & kitchen. Having the bedrooms & bathrooms spread out over 2 floors makes it perfect for traveling with family or colleagues, & since it's just 10 minutes on a bus (or a half-hour walk!) to Wrigley Field, it's a great place to stay to see a game.

additional_house_rules:
No parties or overnight guests without previous approval from the host. Parties are fun, we get it. But we have tenants living above you and below you. Please be respectful after 10pm on weeknights and weekends. We would hate to come knock on your door and be ‚Äúthose people‚Äù who tell you to stop having fun. It makes us look lame and we don‚Äôt want to do it.

Lost keys, it happens! There will be a $30 replacement fee. Please do not go to a locksmith and have them created on your own. 

No pets. We love animals so much, but unfortunately, no animals are allowed. 

Do not engage in illegal activities on the property. Drugs, internet downloading, etc. If you can‚Äôt do it in front a police officer, best to probably not do it in our home. 

If you break or damage something, please do not try to hide it. Let us know so we know that something needs to be repaired or replaced. If you break a wine glass, no need to freak out because we‚Äôve done it too. If you break the television, that‚Äôs a different story and we‚Äôll have to talk about costs and repair. 

No smoking of any kind inside the house and on the porch. If you smoke cigarettes, please go outside. Opening a window doesn‚Äôt quite do the trick.

Recycle! We love recycling, a lot. We would be super grateful if you could also recycle your glass, plastic and paper items in the recycling can on the porch. Mother Earth also loves it! 

Clean up after yourself where possible. We‚Äôre all for doing housekeeping and washing your sheets, but if you could help us out along the way, that‚Äôd be awesome. Throw away any food you don‚Äôt want. Wipe down the counters. And leave your used towels on the bathroom floor.

Triple check that you‚Äôve locked all doors when coming and going. This is for your safety and the safety of the tenants in the building. The front and back door have 2 locks, please make sure they are both locked. The doors to your apartment, feel free to lock at your discretion.

access: You will have full access to the entire 2nd floor apartment. All parts of the apartment are yours to occupy. Also have use of the backyard with a grill.
description:
On a quiet, tree lined street, you will find our comfortable and spacious 3 bedroom, 2nd floor apartment. We are 3 blocks away from the Wicker Park neighborhood where you will find incredible restaurants, bars and boutique shops.

Public transportation is also nearby. Buses are located within a 5 minute walk and the closest train station is a 15 minute walk. You're always close to downtown but also get to enjoy exploring the neighborhoods that define Chicago. 

Perfect for all travelers!

The apartment is fully restored to original oak woodwork, including a built-in hutch, hardwood floors, and 10 ft. ceilings. 

Bedroom #1:  Bunk bed-full size on the bottom and twin bed on top
Bedroom #2: double bed
Bedroom #3: twin bed
Pull out couch: full size
*twin aerobed available upon request

Plenty of street parking in front.

You will have full access to the entire 2nd floor apartment. All parts of the apartment are yours to occupy. Also have use of the backyard with a grill.

Owner lives on the 1st floor.  We respect your privacy but will be happy to answer any questions.

Ukrainian Village is home to an abundance of restaurants, bars, cafes, theatres,  close to the United Center, as well as shopping.

We are located 7 blocks from the Blue Line (public transport)  that will take you directly to Ohare Airport, Downtown, Millennium Park,  Broadway Theatres, as well as to museums. 

We are located:
3.6 miles to Millennium Park, Art Institute, Downtown Chicago (13 minute drive)

3.7 miles to Water Tower Place (14 minute drive)

8.8 miles to Shedd Aquarium, Natural History Museum, and Adler Planetarium (18 minute drive)

6.1 miles to Lincoln Park Zoo (20 minuet drive)

1.7 miles to United Center (8 minute drive)

2 blocks north catch Division Street Bus #70
3 blocks south catch Chicago Ave Buss #66
1 block east catch Damen Ave Bus #50

7 blocks to Damen Ave or Ashland Ave ‚ÄúBlue Line‚Äù stop


**Drive times will vary depending on time of travel 
* all activities are accessible using Chicago Public Transportation (CTA)

This is a quiet neighborhood and we ask that you respect our neighbors.
 Quiet time 10:00 PM to 8:00 AM.
Tenants live on the 1st and 3rd floor

description:
A place to stay that's quiet, comfortable and convenient. 

This is a large private master bedroom in a house shared with our family. Your bedroom includes access to a private new shower/bathroom, gym equipment, kitchen, TV, and everything else you might need for a short or longer-term stay. 

Neighborhood is VERY safe and QUIET! Only 10 minute drive from the Hinsdale BNSF train that can get you to downtown in as little as 20 minutes!

We are flexible - let us know about any special requests!

All towels, Shampoo/conditioner, soaps, laundry, sheets are included. Cable TV, some gym equipment, Wifi are also free.

Someone will always be available to help you with any questions. We are negotiable in terms of shared food and other requests.

Small park located a few blocks away. Safe and quiet! Short ride to the Burr Ridge shopping center with lots of great restaurants including Thai, Sushi, Steakhouse, Coffee, Pizza, etc! Downtown Hinsdale is only a short drive away.

VERY Close to Argonne National Labs!

We are in the suburbs and we recommend a car (or Uber, Lyft, etc) to get around.

access: Private bed and bath, kitchen and dining area (we love group meals!), baby gear (stroller, toys, changing table, port-a-crib), your own set of keys to come and go as you please, AppleTV, outdoor patios, Laundry, car rental (Zipcar), bike share (Divvy), transit/CTA and plenty of street parking
description:
Really big master suite in lovely wicker park 2-level condo. Surrounded by the best food and attractions in the city, 7 minutes walking to the blue line, 20 minutes by train/bus to anything in the city. Perf for festivals, Lolla, Riotfest, Pitchfork

Walk Score 94! Huge private bedroom/bathroom suite in our very large Wicker Park condo. 14' high ceilings and queen sized bed, private bathroom, closet for storage. Wifi, Apple TV and the like provided. Located in the middle of Wicker Park's best attractions, bus/rail, and dining. 

We're a late-20s working professional couple with two awesome babies and a great condo in Chicago's best hood. We're always game for hosting new and great people and would very much like to hear from you!

Wicker Park is hands down the best place in Chicago for foodies, plus we've got great access to the cities many culinary attractions. Our next door neighbor is an Italian cafe frequently referred to as having 'one of Chicago's best patios'. The lakefront/Lincoln Park/Gold Coast/Mag Mile is 10-20 minutes by bus depending on the time and day you are going. Our house is an 8 minute walk from two blue line stops to get you to/from O'hare and Downtown quickly. If going to Midway add a transfer to the Orange line for about 50 minutes total on the train.

Private bed and bath, kitchen and dining area (we love group meals!), baby gear (stroller, toys, changing table, port-a-crib), your own set of keys to come and go as you please, AppleTV, outdoor patios, Laundry, car rental (Zipcar), bike share (Divvy), transit/CTA and plenty of street parking

Up to them, but we love hosting folks and often find time to share a meal and maybe a movie. Usually if we're doing events around town we'll invite guests or even just for coffee/drinks with friends. One lucky couple got to go sailing with us :O

They call Brooklyn the Wicker Park of the East :P - We love our hood, it's full of energy, great food, art, cafes bars and just minutes from downtown and the lakefront or any other great Chicago attraction (Wrigley field!)

There's a bus stop on the street in front of our house. We also have bike-share on our block (Divvy) and are about 7 mins walking to the Damen or Division CTA Blue Line stops which connect downtown and to the airports.

Our only request is that you respect the quiet times for the babies and treat them as you would your own. Thanks!

description:
We know the difficulties of deciding where to eat and what to do in one of the world‚Äôs most happening cities. But with the posh comfort and convenience of the Staypineapple in central Chicago, choosing where to stay will be easy. 

Your room charge and taxes will be paid prior to your arrival. The amenity fee with tax ($17.61 per day) will be charged upon arrival.

The rooms feature a blend of contemporary design with original elegant details and modern furnishings. Large windows allow scenic views of the city, while duvet beds with luxury towels and robes provide maximum comfort. All units include high speed Wi-Fi and complimentary Kuerig coffee and tea.

Staypineapple is conveniently located within steps to many of Chicago‚Äôs top attractions including Millennium Park, the Art Institute of Chicago, and the Magnificent Mile. The Theater District is also just minutes away, and with hundreds of options for world-renown bars and restaurants, you‚Äôll have no trouble finding a great place to hang before and after the show.

Your room will have: 

Air conditioning
Non-smoking rooms
Daily housekeeping
Room service

Unlimited in-room Keurig¬Æ with custom blended coffee and tea

The space offers:

Fitness Center
Bar/Lounge
Business Center
Concierge
Conference Facilities
Dry Cleaning
Laundry Service
Meeting rooms
Multilingual Staff
Pets Allowed
Wheelchair access

access: Guest can use the refrigerator and microwave. If the stove top be used, let me know.
description:
My place is close to NorthEastern University, North Park University, Little India and Lincolnwood mall. Swedish Covenant hospital is in walkable distance and Weiss memorial and St. Joseph are also close and can be reached by Public transportation which is available outside the door.

My place is in walkable distance to restaurants, groceries and Indian shopping center and other malls like Lincoln wood and also to North East university and North park.

Guest can use the refrigerator and microwave. If the stove top be used, let me know.

Guests can get in touch with me by phone, talk or texting. Can talk when I'm home. Yes, we live here and will be available if need be. I need to know in advance when they would be checking in and checking out.

Our place is in a quiet and safe neighborhood and also on the main bus route which connects to other forms of transportation. Which can get you to down town and most suburbs .There are parks and walking trails in walkable distance. Stores, Restaurants, fast food,  malls, groceries in walking distance.

There's public transportation from right from our door to down town, airports,  to many suburbs other places.

I would like the guests to keep the places like tub, sink etc they use clean and free of debris like hair etc when they take shower and shave.  So it  doesn't stop up draining the water.

access: Kitchen, 2 full bathrooms, 2 living rooms, work space,  free dryer and washer in unit for guests staying +7 days.
description:
Welcome to our lovely home! This place is literally next to Downtown Chicago. The freeway is just one block away so it‚Äôs easy to get in&out of the City. Free parking on the street(24/7). It has a train station only 0.5miles(10-12minutes walk) this train goes to Downtown & Airport. best thing! it has a bus stop right by the door of the building. This bus goes to the heart of downtown. Two bathrooms, wiFi, coffee maker, iron, shampoo, towels, everything you might need.

You can use both full bathrooms, kitchen, the living room and everything that we have at this place. In the room you will have a comfy queen size bed, night stand, lamp, iron, iron table, clean towels, clean sheets, comforter. The room has a lock from the outside. We provide WiFi, coffee, shampoo, body soap, hair dryer, hair brush, toilet paper, etc. Free washer and dryer in unit( only for guests staying 7days+)

Kitchen, 2 full bathrooms, 2 living rooms, work space,  free dryer and washer in unit for guests staying +7 days.

We might not meet personally but I‚Äôm available 24/7 for you and all your needs. Very easy to reach by text and call.

Very close to downtown and very easy to reach. By train ( blue line station 24/7 only 8 stops - 14minutes on train - to Millenium park ). 25 to Millenium park by bus 7 harrison. 11 minutes by UBER, lyft, v√≠a rate from $5-$11 to go to Millenium park. Only 5minutes away from West Loop one of the nicest areas with a lot of restaurants, bars, clubs, etc. 5minutes to Rush hospital. Good for people coming for interviews. Here in Chicago there is a lot of people who are homeless but you won‚Äôt have any issues with them. you might see some people who are homeless around the place because there is a shelter close by but they‚Äôre not selling drugs or committing felonies. Neither me nor my guests have had or have witnessed anything dangerous or weird at all.

Free parking in the street 24/7 unlimited parking spots right by the building on left side of the building. You can get here by train, bus, driving or taxi.

The room is private but you will share common areas ( kitchen , living room, and the bathroom/s) with other Airbnb guests. Usually none of this get crowd because most of Airbnb guests are most of the time outside the house knowing the city, in concerts, interviews, etc, and they don‚Äôt spend much time in the house. A private apartment in the area usually cost over 120$ p/night plus taxes and fees which is in total almost 200$ p/night ! If you want save some money and being close to downtown, surrounding great public transportation and with free street parking this could be a great option for you! 
The room has one full size bed. If you want to add 3rd or 4th guest in the reservation I could add 1 extra air mattress with no extra fee if the reservation is set for 3 or 4. If the reservation is for 2 and you‚Äôd like to have an extra air mattress we charge $15p/night and we provide air mattress and linens for it. the room will become smaller for luggage becase you will have two beds on it. This is a good option if you want to save even more money otherwise you can book two rooms! 
As most houses in United States this is not made with concrete so you will hear people walking or outside sounds. It doesn‚Äôt bother most of the guest but if you are a very light sleeper maybe you should choose an entire place. or have an earphone or something to block the sound. There will be security cameras ON in shared spaces only( living room, kitchen, hallways, entrance of the apartment, exits of the apartment).

access: Guests may use living room, kitchen, work desk with printer, laundry room in the basement.
description:
Guests room includes flat screen TV with Apple TV  and HDMI cable so you can connect your laptop. Also includes a mini fridge. There is a desk and chair complete with desk lamp, power strip, and basic office supplies. 

Living room has couch, Apple TV, Chromecast, big screen tv with surround sound. Guest gets their own private bathroom with fresh laundered towels. Guests room is right next to full kitchen with access to balcony.

There is free street parking one block from apartment!

Guests room is spacious and on a quiet street and connected to your own private bathroom. The room has a TV, Apple TV, desk and chair, mini fridge, queen sized mattress,  iron and ironing board, hairdryer upon request, closet with hangers. It is right next to kitchen and balcony.

Guests may use living room, kitchen, work desk with printer, laundry room in the basement.

I‚Äôm very open to guests who like to socialize and also respect guests who prefer little to no interaction. It‚Äôs totally up to the guest.

2 blocks from Loyola Red Line stop. Near Loyola campus. 4 blocks to the lake. Near lots of restaurants and bars. Target is 2 blocks away. There is also a CVS 4 blocks away. Grocery store 3 blocks away. Restaurants I recommend(all within 3 blocks of apartment):
Nori Sushi, Starbucks, Potbelly, Bop‚Äôn Grill, Five Guys,  McDonalds, Popeyes, Dunkin Donuts, Potbelly, Clarke‚Äôs, Star Grill, Cilantro Thai Cuisine and many other Restaurants within very close proximity.

Red line stop 2 blocks away, bus stop right out front.
interaction: I‚Äôm very open to guests who like to socialize and also respect guests who prefer little to no interaction. It‚Äôs totally up to the guest.
neighborhood_overview:
2 blocks from Loyola Red Line stop. Near Loyola campus. 4 blocks to the lake. Near lots of restaurants and bars. Target is 2 blocks away. There is also a CVS 4 blocks away. Grocery store 3 blocks away. Restaurants I recommend(all within 3 blocks of apartment):
Nori Sushi, Starbucks, Potbelly, Bop‚Äôn Grill, Five Guys,  McDonalds, Popeyes, Dunkin Donuts, Potbelly, Clarke‚Äôs, Star Grill, Cilantro Thai Cuisine and many other Restaurants within very close proximity.
space: Guests room is spacious and on a quiet street and connected to your own private bathroom. The room has a TV, Apple TV, desk and chair, mini fridge, queen sized mattress,  iron and ironing board, hairdryer upon request, closet with hangers. It is right next to kitchen and balcony.
summary:
Guests room includes flat screen TV with Apple TV  and HDMI cable so you can connect your laptop. Also includes a mini fridge. There is a desk and chair complete with desk lamp, power strip, and basic office supplies. 

Living room has couch, Apple TV, Chromecast, big screen tv with surround sound. Guest gets their own private bathroom with fresh laundered towels. Guests room is right next to full kitchen with access to balcony.

There is free street parking one block from apartment!

access: You have exclusive use of the interior of the 2 bedroom condo. The area in which the washer and dryer are located is common space, but the washer and dryer themselves are accessible only to you. Once you exit the building towards the backyard and patio, you enter more shared space.
description:
This 2 bedroom condo has entirely new EVERYTHING! Located in vintage World's Columbian Exposition era building, it's been newly renovated and updated. You can't get much closer to the University of Chicago campus. This quiet condo is within walking distance of lakefront beaches, golf courses, the Museum of Science and Industry, public transportation, and Jackson Park.

Brand new washer and dryer, furniture, bedding, television, Bose soundbar, and kitchen appliances.

You have exclusive use of the interior of the 2 bedroom condo. The area in which the washer and dryer are located is common space, but the washer and dryer themselves are accessible only to you. Once you exit the building towards the backyard and patio, you enter more shared space.

I know this city like the back of my hand. Feel free to ask for info.

Because the condo is adjacent to the University of Chicago campus, there is a youthful and lively air to the community. You are likely to see many students and professors walking through the neighborhood, as well as inside the restaurants and businesses of the area.

The best way to get around the immediate area is by car, but if you wish to venture into the bustling streets of the downtown area, public transportation is the best way to avoid traffic. The Metra Electric Line, which  takes you straight into the heart of downtown Chicago, has a station at the Midway Plaisance, next to the intersection of 59th Street and Harper Avenue.

Coffee, tea and assorted snacks. I.E. granola bars, trail mix and Belvita bars provided.
Please make note; Feel free to use our shopping bags (in the pantry), the City of Chicago charges 7 cents tax on each grocery store bag given at the store. Reduce Reuse Recycle!

access: In addition to your room, you'll have shared access to the kitchen, living room, and bathroom.
description:
This is a private room in a three-bedroom apartment. Restaurants, shops, and bars are all within walking distance. Downtown is a 12-minute train ride away via the adjacent Armitage Brown Line station.

Trove guests have exclusive FREE access to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower. Check "Exclusive Trove Perks" in the listing description for details.

Thanks so much for your interest in staying with us! We ask that you read through our entire listing to make sure that we're the right hosts for you.

PLEASE NOTE

This room is adjacent to the "L" train tracks. This means you will hear train noise regularly in the apartment and your room. 

THIS TROVE HAS

‚úî Twin-size bed
‚úî Turkish cotton bath and hand towels
‚úî 46" HDTV w/ Netflix (no cable TV)
‚úî Keurig coffee maker
‚úî Body wash and shampoo
‚úî Iron and ironing board
‚úî Hairdryer
‚úî Keyless Entry

--and more!

EXCLUSIVE TROVE PERKS

During your stay as a Trove guest, you receive a free membership to The Metropolitan, a members-only club and co-working space located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower (for reservations <14 days).  Included with your membership:

‚úî Upscale co-working space, dining, and bars
‚úî Stunning views of Chicago and Lake Michigan
‚úî Discounted express tickets to the Willis Tower Skydeck

Message us for more details!

HAVE A QUESTION?

Check out the ‚ÄúOther Things to Note‚Äù section of this listing for the answers to our most frequently asked questions.

In addition to your room, you'll have shared access to the kitchen, living room, and bathroom.

WHY STAY WITH TROVE?

‚≠ê Fast Communication
We‚Äôre always on call to answer your questions, typically within 30 minutes.

‚≠ê Experienced Hosts
We‚Äôve hosted thousands of guests over five years.

‚≠ê Easy Self-Check-In
Keyless access means no keys for you manage during your stay!

‚≠ê Central Location
You‚Äôll never be far from local spots to check out, sights to see, and public transit.

We‚Äôre located on the north side of Chicago in Lincoln Park, one of Chicago‚Äôs trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We‚Äôre also minutes away from many of Chicago‚Äôs most popular spots.

Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber.

‚Üí The Armitage Brown Line 'L' train station is next door.
‚Üí O'Hare is 50 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber.
‚Üí Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

1. ‚ÄúHow do I get to ‚Äòx‚Äô from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‚Äòx‚Äô?‚Äù

Directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. We're next to the Armitage  'L' train station. Search for ‚ÄúArmitage Brown Line station Chicago‚Äù in Maps, click the ‚ÄúDirections‚Äù button, then enter your point of interest.

2. ‚ÄúIs there parking nearby?‚Äù

Parking in Chicago is often difficult and even more so in the evening and during special events. We recommend using a service called SpotHero because it allows you to reserve a nearby paid parking spot in advance so that you don‚Äôt have to worry about finding parking when you arrive.

3. When is check-in/check-out?

Check-in is 3 p.m. or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room.

Check-out is at 11 a.m. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11 a.m., but you‚Äôre welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up by 2:30 p.m. at the latest.

4. ‚ÄúCan a third person stay in the room with me?‚Äù

We allow a maximum of one guest in this room. We have additional rooms available if you need accommodations for more people. Send us a message for more info.

5. Will I have my own private bathroom?

The bathroom is shared with the other bedrooms.

Per Airbnb policy, only guests booked through Airbnb can stay overnight with us.

additional_house_rules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time for unexpected repairs and/or to enforce the terms of this agreement.  Should the Tenants violate any of this agreement the rental period shall be terminated immediately.  The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental periods.  

The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. 

The Tenants shall not sublet the property 

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

No children under 12 without special written permission from the landlord.

No smoking inside the premises.  Smoking is permitted on the balcony and the deck but Tenant will be charged if any damage is caused to the property. 

No firearms, fireworks or other hazardous material shall be in or on property.

Tenants shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, etc shall cause termination of this agreement.

The tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting that rights of the surrounding property owners. 

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above the normal wear and tear. 

The Tenants and Tenants' Guest shall be hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury, or loss.  Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for the property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants and the Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

description:
Pricing is for 1 unit.  Please let us know if you need both units and we will update the quote.  Each unit is a 3 bedroom and 2 bath.

PALACE-   2nd/3rd floor with private deck over the 2 car garage. Sleeps 8-10 
LOFT-         Top unit-4th and 5th floor w/rooftop deck.  Sleeps 6-8

-Trendy Wicker Park & Bucktown neighborhoods!! 
- (Google Augusta Blvd and Division Street 60622)
-Train from O'Hare airport and to downtown is 5 min walk.

-The REAL reason to stay in our Wicker Park area is the super trendy shops, the very unique local establishments for great food, fun music and awesome patio's for people watching.  Don't fall into the tourist trap and pay the crazy prices to stay and play downtown.

This is a 3 unit building. The ground floor is a real estate store then we have 2 rental units.  The first floor of each unit is identical to the other unit.  The difference is the top floor of each unit. 

"PALACE" - is the bigger unit, on the 2nd/3rd floor, 3 bed, 2 bath, private deck over the 2 car garage. 
‚Ä¢Sleeps 8-10 (a king bed, 2 queen beds, a full size sofa sleeper in the living room and a queen sofa sleeper in the loft area).   
You walk up one flight of stairs to the unit. As you walk in the unit there are 2 bedrooms (queen beds) that are next to each other and right outside of the bedrooms is the guest bath that has a shower.  When you walk to the front of the unit you have the kitchen and the living room area (full size sofa sleeper) and fireplace.  You walk up the stairs to the loft (queen sleeper sofa) and the master bedroom (king bed) with master bath is in the back of the unit. Huge deck over 2 car garage and outside balcony on outside the master bedroom on the third floor. 

The other unit is the -LOFT" -the 4th and 5th floor (NO ELEVATOR), 3 bedrooms, 2 bath, with private rooftop deck. 
‚Ä¢Sleeps 6-8 (a king bed, 2 queen beds and a full size sofa sleeper in the living room).  
You walk up to the top landing (4 flight of stairs) to enter the condo.   As you walk in the unit there are 2 bedrooms (queen beds) that are next to each other, balcony too, and the guest bath that has a shower outside the bedrooms.  When you walk to the front of the unit you have the kitchen and the living room area (full size sofa sleeper) and fireplace.  You walk up the stairs to the master bedroom (with a king bed in the loft), master bath, washer/dryer and then the rooftop deck is in the back.

East Village / Bucktown / Wicker Park / Ukranian Village area. 

The deck and rooftop has plenty of couches and chairs to enjoy your morning coffee, catch some rays and sit outside with a glass of wine after the exciting day in Chicago. 

- It has all the amenities dishes, pots & pans, towels & linens, cable television, wireless internet (code will be provided)

Walking distance are unique boutiques(Noir, le Dress, Paper Doll, Penelope's, Pagoda Red, Nina, Psycho Baby, Pavilion,), art galleries, theaters, restaurants, summer patio's, nightclubs and coffeehouses (Ex. Ruxbin Kitchen, Bedford, Prasino, the Boundary, Jerry's, Fifty/50, Frontier, Estate, Arami, Smoke Daddy's).

- Take the TRAIN (Blue Line) from O'Hare to Division Street and walk 2 blocks to condo. Same TRAIN (Blue line) takes you to the downtown area in 10 minutes (about 2 miles),  2 blocks away is Chicago Ave to catch the bus to Michigan Avenue area. (about a mile).  Best part is to get exhausted exploring the city and you are only a $10 taxi ride back to condo. For our travelers with cars we are 5 minutes from the expressway and street parking is free.

Born and raised in Chicago so let me know if you have any questions!!

Trendy East Village / Bucktown / Wicker Park / Ukranian Village area.

Our location is Ashland/Augusta.  Zipcode is 60622. The Division Blue Line train from airports/downtown is a 5 minute walk from the condo.   We are 10 minutes from most of the tourist attractions (4 stops on the train).   Hop on the Chicago 66 bus to/from Michigan Avenue and Navy Pier.
house_rules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time for unexpected repairs and/or to enforce the terms of this agreement.  Should the Tenants violate any of this agreement the rental period shall be terminated immediately.  The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental periods.  

The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. 

The Tenants shall not sublet the property 

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

No children under 12 without special written permission from the landlord.

No smoking inside the premises.  Smoking is permitted on the balcony and the deck but Tenant will be charged if any damage is caused to the property. 

No firearms, fireworks or other hazardous material shall be in or on property.

Tenants shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, etc shall cause termination of this agreement.

The tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting that rights of the surrounding property owners. 

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above the normal wear and tear. 

The Tenants and Tenants' Guest shall be hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury, or loss.  Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for the property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants and the Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

This unit is located in the basement. Have a nice small kitchenette with a microwave and a fridge.
Unit is full of windows all around.
description:
This is an Old Chicago house built in 1880 and remodelled in 2018.
Very close to Clark Street , North Pond, Diversey Harbor and Lincoln Park Zoo.

*** Basement Unit ***

Safest neighborhood in the City
One stop train ride from Wrigleyville.
Lincoln Park is a park along the lakefront of Chicago, facing Lake Michigan. Several museums and a zoo are located between North Avenue (1600 N) and Diversey Parkway (2800 N) in the Lincoln Park area. The park further to the north is characterized by parkland, beaches, recreational areas, nature reserves, and harbors. To the south, there is a more narrow strip of beaches east of Lake Shore Drive, almost to downtown. Lincoln Park is the second-most-visited park in the United States.
Our unit is located 30 seconds walk to Lincoln Park and 30 seconds walk to Clark Street , Full of Bars , Restaurants and shops.
Endless restaurants, shops, bars, and nightlife within walking distance.

This unit is located in the basement. Have a nice small kitchenette with a microwave and a fridge.
Unit is full of windows all around.

We live upstairs, guests can reach us easily.

North Pond, Clark St. restaurants and bars. Lincoln Park Zoo.

There is free parking on Lakeview St , crossing st. to the East end of the street.

No sitting or smoking in front of the main door to the building.

description:
Free garage parking till 1/12/20. Across from McCormick perfect Chicago location! 1 King Size bed and 1 pull out couch luxury condo w/ balcony - Green Line Train stop and Michigan ave bus is right outside the building, Very close to Soldier Field , HUGE POOL AND HOT TUB FOR RELAXATION & Gym & Business Center . Store right outside.

Parking available at extra cost. 


1BR / 1Ba 750ft Loft with Balcony 
w/d in unit attached garage (extra charge per night via building or monthly rates apply)

PRIVATE CONDO AMENITIES 
‚Ä¢Granite kitchen and breakfast bar -- fully stocked with plates, glassware, silverware, etc 
‚Ä¢Granite bathroom and shower -- towels and linens included 
‚Ä¢Light hardwood floors throughout and modern rugs throughout condo 
‚Ä¢Modern leather sectional sofa 
‚Ä¢Queen bedroom with 500-thread count linens and pillow top mattress 
‚Ä¢Sheik modern design and furniture inspired from European design 
‚Ä¢55" LED LCD TV and Surround Sound 
‚Ä¢WiFi, cable TV, movies, and all utilities included 
‚Ä¢Parking available on street or indoor heated garage (for extra fee)

AMENITIES AT THE LEX 
‚Ä¢the BOILER ROOM -- 24-hour fitness center 
‚Ä¢the LIBRARY -- 24-hour business center 
‚Ä¢the LIVING ROOM -- Party lounge with billiards, fireplace, and TV 
‚Ä¢the PLAYGROUND -- Expansive landscaped deck including outdoor pool and hot tub featuring barbeque grills, lounge seating, fire pit and panoramic views of the lake, Downtown Chicago and the entire South Loop Pinball machine in lobby 
‚Ä¢Complimentary Wi-Fi in the apartment common areas 
‚Ä¢On-site professional apartment management 
‚Ä¢Private dog run 
‚Ä¢24-hour door staff and maintenance 
‚Ä¢On-site heated parking garage 
‚Ä¢Furnished overnight guest suite 
‚Ä¢Bicycle and resident storage 
‚Ä¢Close to Chicago's public transportation, highways and lakefront recreation 
‚Ä¢A smoke-free Chicago apartment property designed for LEED certification

Please let us know your dates. We'll give you a direct quote. Will respond to all inquiries.

description:
New, big & bright condo in a modern building on a street with 24/buses. You'll have a master bedroom with tons of privacy and own bathroom.

Modern condo building with alarms, security cameras, an elevator in a nice quiet area. It is also located on a street with 24/7 bus service. About 15-20 minutes from O'Hare Airport. Friendly neighbors as well as tons of free parking all around the building. 
The space is clean and spacious. It is well furnished, and you'll have a whole master bedroom with a bed as well as fold-out sofa-bed if you need it. 
The room has a private bathroom with a shower. 
An office desk as well as big closet and shelves are yours to use. 
The common area such as the living room, dining room, kitchen, and a huge outdoor patio has everything you'll need as well. 
I love my place, and hope you do too.

Feel free to hang out in other areas other than my own private bedroom. 
Check with me with any questions.

As little or as much as you would like. You have a whole master bedroom in your disposal.

Nice and quiet. All residential. Has a lot of Eastern European cafes and grocery stores.

Not far from blue line which takes you straight to O'Hare or down town. Uber to the airport should not be more than $20.

I'll leave you a note with the basic tips, commute and food options near by.
house_rules:
No strict rules, just common sense and courtesy. 
No smoking, no pets, no parties. 
I'd prefer personal cooking to be minimal. If you are planning on cooking a lot - this listing might not be a good fit for you. 
Be a good person, that is all.

additional_house_rules:
Let's do this:

CHECK-IN: 3:00 pm, but it can be earlier depending on whether a guest was there that morning, how quickly I can get the unit cleaned, etc. If you need to drop off bags earlier in the day we're happy to store them.

CHECK-OUT: 12:00 pm. I'm flexible if no one is coming in later that day, but if I've got another guest coming at 3:00 I'm afraid I have to throw ya' out by noon. If you need to leave your luggage here because you have a late flight just let me know.

CANCELLATION: We're considered "moderate" on the Airbnb scale.

SMOKING: Not in the apartment, please. There is a sitting area and ashtray right outside the back door, or you can go on the front porch.

PETS: Not allowed, sorry. 

ACCOMMODATIONS: The beds comfortably sleep three people, but it's possible to squeeze a second person in The Library and an additional person on the futon in the living room. We account for 4 guests in the room rental price but would charge an extra $25 per night for guest #5. No more than five guests are allowed. If the futon will be needed please notify us ahead of time so we can have it made up as a bed for you.

VISITORS: Feel free to invite over a few friends or family, but in order to be respectful to our neighbors we can't allow loud parties. If you want to reserve the backyard for a small get-together in the warm months just run it by us first (but unfortunately no grill is available).

access:
As our guest you will have the entire first floor of the building, which has a separate locking entrance off the foyer. There is one master bedroom with a queen-sized bed, plus The Library which has a full-sized (or "double") bed. Both bedrooms have closets, luggage racks, extra pillows, extra blankets, alarm clocks, hangers, and of course, bedding/sheets/comforters. In special circumstances the futon in the living room can be made up as a bed as well--please inquire in advance.

The kitchen has all the basic cooking gear (full list available upon request), and if you find yourself needing to borrow a specific gadget or an ingredient you forgot to grab at the store, just ask! A Keurig coffee maker and K-cups/sugar/creamer are also provided.

The bathroom includes the basics (toilet paper, shampoo, body wash, conditioner, hair dryer, towels, wash cloths) plus Q-tips, Kleenex, make-up removal cloths, and a lint roller.

Additional amenities include:

* Free and reliable wireless internet connection
* Complimentary parking passes if you drive (see "Getting Around" below)
* Television in the living room with extended cable plus HBO. The extensive Comcast OnDemand library is also available, as well as a Chromecast.
* Laundry facilities in the basement, but because the basement has a separate outside entrance access is upon request only.
* Access to the back deck and backyard. If you're planning an outdoor get-together please check with us first (see House Rules). Also note that our dogs can sometimes be found in the yard (see Other Things to Note), but they're more than happy to share!
* The office comes equipped with a desk, desk lamp, and numerous books and literature on Chicago history and other information for visitors. A map of the immediate area is also provided.
description:
Situated mere feet from Logan Square itself and the (quiet) underground Logan Square Blue Line train stop for easy 24/7 downtown and O'Hare access. Convenient street parking--only cars with special permits can park on our block, and we provide you with those permits. We've lovingly preserved our 1907 greystone & look forward to hosting you in beautiful Chicago!

Coming to see HAMILTON? The Blue Line (1 block away) will whisk you to the same block as the CIBC Theatre. Ask us for details!

Our classic Chicago greystone lies on a quiet residential street, half a block off Logan Square proper. My partner Cory and I strive to keep our home clean and comfortable, and the decor is very much a reflection of our personalities and our years of living here. Vintage furniture and artwork combined with a host of amenities have long been enjoyed by visiting family and friends, and we hope to extend the same level of hospitality to our Airbnb guests. We'll always be nearby and are happy to assist in any way we can!

(Tip: The Airbnb Map only shows the approximate locations of properties, and their placement is wildly inaccurate. Don't trust the map! We're on Troy Street, half a block north of Logan Boulevard. Many of the properties that appear near us on the map are actually quite far away, so proceed with caution!)

As our guest you will have the entire first floor of the building, which has a separate locking entrance off the foyer. There is one master bedroom with a queen-sized bed, plus The Library which has a full-sized (or "double") bed. Both bedrooms have closets, luggage racks, extra pillows, extra blankets, alarm clocks, hangers, and of course, bedding/sheets/comforters. In special circumstances the futon in the living room can be made up as a bed as well--please inquire in advance.

The kitchen has all the basic cooking gear (full list available upon request), and if you find yourself needing to borrow a specific gadget or an ingredient you forgot to grab at the store, just ask! A Keurig coffee maker and K-cups/sugar/creamer are also provided.

The bathroom includes the basics (toilet paper, shampoo, body wash, conditioner, hair dryer, towels, wash cloths) plus Q-tips, Kleenex, make-up removal cloths, and a lint roller.

Additional amenities include:

* Free and reliable wireless internet connection
* Complimentary parking passes if you drive (see "Getting Around" below)
* Television in the living room with extended cable plus HBO. The extensive Comcast OnDemand library is also available, as well as a Chromecast.
* Laundry facilities in the basement, but because the basement has a separate outside entrance access is upon request only.
* Access to the back deck and backyard. If you're planning an outdoor get-together please check with us first (see House Rules). Also note that our dogs can sometimes be found in the yard (see Other Things to Note), but they're more than happy to share!
* The office comes equipped with a desk, desk lamp, and numerous books and literature on Chicago history and other information for visitors. A map of the immediate area is also provided.

You'll meet me at check-in, but after that the amount of interaction we have is entirely up to you. I'm more than happy to give recommendations or directions or even a brief history of the house itself, but if you don't ask I'll simply vanish. You can also text me anytime if you need concierge tips (i.e. "I'm at Willis Tower, how do I get home?").

We're situated on the same block as the world-famous Longman & Eagle--but on the quiet, residential side--which also puts us half a block from Logan Square itself. The Centennial Monument, the legendary Lula Cafe, The Logan Theatre, Lost Lake, the Logan Square Comfort Station, Billy Sunday, Fat Rice, the Logan Square Farmer's Market, Mi Tocaya Antojeria, Quiote, Revolution Brewing, the Chicago Diner (vegan), and countless other bars and restaurants are all within a half mile from our front door. Of course there are also coffee shops, book stores, arcades, and even a medical marijuana dispensary, but if you're looking for something special just ask and we'll steer you in the right direction!

Tip: The phrase "Logan Square" refers to both the square and to the enormous neighborhood surrounding it, which can be confusing. There are parts of Logan Square the Neighborhood that generally aren't as convenient for tourists, so don't assume that all rentals "in Logan Square" are comparable.

Another tip: Hosts on Airbnb have the option of either showing the exact location of their property on the map, or showing its "approximate location" in a large blueish circle that spans half the neighborhood. Be cautious of hosts choosing to use the blue circle as that may mean their location isn't very convenient. We've always proudly advertised our exact address--we even posted a satellite photo--because our block is second to none!

ON FOOT: Part of the reason we live here is because so many things are in easy walking distance. We provide a custom map showing some of our favorite nearby restaurants, bars and other necessities (pharmacy, theaters, bank, landmarks) and encourage you to go out exploring! It's a very safe area--the countless people walking dogs mean you're never alone--so don't hesitate to hoof it.

BY BIKE: Chicago has a network of Divvy bike rental kiosks blanketing the city, and our nearest location is one block away. The Divvy stations in the immediate area are also depicted on our homemade map.

BY TRAIN: We're less than a block from an underground Blue Line stop, which means easy access to the train but without all the noise. The Blue Line is the train that runs to O'Hare International Airport, so if you're flying in to O'Hare getting here is a very quick and easy ride. The Blue Line also runs to Wicker Park and then on into downtown.

BUS: There's a bus terminal for the CTA #56 (West Loop) and #76 (Lincoln Park) buses right above the entrance to the Blue Line stop, one block away.

CAB: There's a cab stand across the street from Longman & Eagle just around the corner, and of course Uber and Lyft are very popular here if you want them to come to your door.

CAR: If you drove to Chicago or have a rental car, we'll provide you with complimentary parking passes that will allow you to park on our street. Because the street is permit-only it makes parking near our home quite easy.

Have allergies or sensitivities? We primarily use unscented and sensitive skin-type detergents and cleansers, and a full list of the products we use on your floor is available upon request.

We do have two medium-sized dogs. If you meet them in the yard they are extremely friendly, but if you're not "a dog person" just let us know and we'll happily keep them at bay.

Noise is a complaint in a lot of negative Airbnb reviews, so to avoid any unpleasant surprises we want to address noise directly: In our home you will not hear the train (it's elevated in most of Chicago, but the Logan Square stop is underground) and sirens are few and far between. And while our dogs keep the building extremely safe and we keep them quiet while we have guests, you still might hear the dogs bark briefly when the front door opens or when someone rings the doorbell. One of the joys of dog ownership!

And this should come as no surprise, but you might also hear our footsteps. We have rugs blanketing the 2nd floor to muffle and do our best to tiptoe, but the reality is that it's an old building and you are likely going to hear the occasional steps and floorboard squeaks as you would in any first floor unit.
house_rules:
Let's do this:

CHECK-IN: 3:00 pm, but it can be earlier depending on whether a guest was there that morning, how quickly I can get the unit cleaned, etc. If you need to drop off bags earlier in the day we're happy to store them.

CHECK-OUT: 12:00 pm. I'm flexible if no one is coming in later that day, but if I've got another guest coming at 3:00 I'm afraid I have to throw ya' out by noon. If you need to leave your luggage here because you have a late flight just let me know.

CANCELLATION: We're considered "moderate" on the Airbnb scale.

SMOKING: Not in the apartment, please. There is a sitting area and ashtray right outside the back door, or you can go on the front porch.

PETS: Not allowed, sorry. 

ACCOMMODATIONS: The beds comfortably sleep three people, but it's possible to squeeze a second person in The Library and an additional person on the futon in the living room. We account for 4 guests in the room rental price but would charge an extra $25 per night for guest #5. No more than five guests are allowed. If the futon will be needed please notify us ahead of time so we can have it made up as a bed for you.

VISITORS: Feel free to invite over a few friends or family, but in order to be respectful to our neighbors we can't allow loud parties. If you want to reserve the backyard for a small get-together in the warm months just run it by us first (but unfortunately no grill is available).

1. No onsite parking
2. No late checkout past 11am
3. Quiet time after 10pm
4. ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises
5. Lost or misplaced keys will be charged at cost (up to $100)
6. We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered

We look forward to hosting you!  If you are unable to abide by house rules, please consider another listing as we reserve the right to end your stay early for serious violations.  We take pride in our home and are excited to welcome you, but please respect the space and others who live in the building.

description:
Steep yourself in city luxury with this suite located in the South Loop. With high ceilings, granite countertops, a private balcony, and even a rooftop pool, this loft bundles all the allure of the urban environment into one delightful place to stay‚Äîa central spot equally suited to lounging all afternoon or snatching Ô¨Åve minutes of quiet time between meetings.

Zencity is the easiest decision you‚Äôll make in travel. With simple 24-hour check-in, a dedicated customer service agent always available, and consistently high standards you can trust, we help you embrace the joy of traveling without any of the stress.

Access is available to the entire apartment.

We will be available throughout your stay to recommend local attractions, dining, nightlife, or any other concierge services that interest you.

Known for its close access to Grant Park, McCormick Place Convention Center, Museum Campus, and the Loop, the South Loop puts you close to many of Chicago‚Äôs beloved attractions and popular event spaces‚Äîand if you want to venture farther, you‚Äôre just a few steps away from public transportation.

Cab/Uber service is easily available in this location and is our preferred method of transportation downtown. The apartment is also within a 10-minute walk to several train lines including the Red, Green, and Orange lines.

We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered. If anything is not to your liking, please notify us, and we will correct the situation as soon as possible.
house_rules:
1. No onsite parking
2. No late checkout past 11am
3. Quiet time after 10pm
4. ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises
5. Lost or misplaced keys will be charged at cost (up to $100)
6. We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered

We look forward to hosting you!  If you are unable to abide by house rules, please consider another listing as we reserve the right to end your stay early for serious violations.  We take pride in our home and are excited to welcome you, but please respect the space and others who live in the building.

access: You'll have full access to the entire loft, and several shared bathrooms - cleaned daily - just down the hall, plus the building's laundry room.
description:
This studio in Old Town is great for 1-2 travelers and is steps to all that the Old Town neighborhood has to offer! The location is ideal for seeing everything you've got on your list: across the street from Second City, Steppenwolf & Lincoln Park, the Zoo, North Ave Beach & about 20 minutes' train ride from the Loop or Wrigley Field. There are countless restaurants nearby, too, plus a seasonal Farmer's Market.

This unit doesn't have its own bathroom, and instead shares access to several bathrooms - cleaned daily - conveniently located near the unit.

You'll have full access to the entire loft, and several shared bathrooms - cleaned daily - just down the hall, plus the building's laundry room.

This loft has access to several shared bathrooms - cleaned daily - just down the hall.

access:
ENTRY
This building and apartment use keypads.

SPACE
You will have full use of the space to yourselves - dining nook, living room, bedroom, bathroom, and kitchen. Linens and towels are provided for all guests.
description:
**NEW: Roku TV and 1GB wifi for lightening-speed connectivity, updated Dec 2019**

You'll love this oversized 1-bedroom apartment, complete with living room, dining nook, kitchen, bedroom, and bathroom. Feel right at home on lovely tree-lined residential block. Very close to public transit, stores/restaurants, and Hollywood beach!

Only 3 min walk to the Thorndale red line train!

**To read more, EXPAND the below section**

Enjoy this spacious unit as you explore Chicago! It‚Äôs the perfect mix of vintage charm with modern decor, plus it features hardwood floors and crown molding throughout the space. 

LIVING ROOM: 18‚Äô x 16‚Äô includes 50" Roku TV (added Dec 2019), futon couch (sleeps 2 kids / small adults or 1 adult), arm chair, bar, and 1GB wifi (updated Nov 2019)

DINING NOOK: 11‚Äôx10‚Äô dining table and 4 stools, located off of living room.

KITCHEN: 8‚Äôx12‚Äô kitchen stocked with cookware and dining ware for your use. Microwave, stove, fridge, coffee maker and sink. Note there is no dishwasher.

BEDROOM: 15‚Äôx12‚Äô Bedroom with queen-size bed, large closet with hangers to store clothes, 2 nightstands & includes linens.

BATHROOM: 6‚Äô x 8‚Äô with shower, vanity & toilet. Shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hand soap, trash bags, bath towels, face cloths, hair dryer, and bath mat are provided. Bathroom may be entered from within bedroom or from hallway.

ENTRY
This building and apartment use keypads.

SPACE
You will have full use of the space to yourselves - dining nook, living room, bedroom, bathroom, and kitchen. Linens and towels are provided for all guests.

HEAT/AC
The unit has central heat plus window AC in the living room and bedroom.

WASHER/DRYER
Coin-operated washers and dryers are located in the building‚Äôs basement and shared with other apartments. Detergent is available in the kitchen for your use.

CRIB
Pack-and-play crib may be rented for $5/day with 2+ day advance arrangements. Please mention this during booking, and it will be inside unit waiting for you. Note that you must supply your own sheets and blankets for the crib.

This multi-unit building is right near the lake, with easy access to Hollywood Beach and the lakefront trail & parks for running/biking. Restaurants of all cuisines, lively bars, and unique stores abound in the Edgewater neighborhood. Only 10-min walk to Andersonville neighborhood with more cute stores and restaurants.

lf you have a car, there is free street parking in the area (no permit required).

Public transportation is an easy and convenient way to get around the city. It's .2 mi to the Thorndale red-line stop. In addition, there are multiple bus options, including the 146 express bus and 151. I am happy to provide additional detail about our public transit system, as well as directions. The bus is $2/person, while the train is $2.25/person; there are also unlimited 3-day passes for $21 and 7-day passes for $28.

CHECK-IN
Check-in is at 4pm or later. You will be sent detailed entry info for self check-in.  Luggage storage may be available from 10:30am-4pm if arranged in advance.

PARKING
Please note that the free parking is street parking, so you will need to look for a spot once you arrive. The free street parking is first-come, first-served and distance from unit cannot be guaranteed.  

STAIRS
Please note this is a 2nd floor unit, and this building does NOT have an elevator.

COURTESY
Please note this unit is on a quiet residential street. We respect our neighbors and keep quiet hours from 10pm-8am. Therefore, if your group is looking for more of a party environment, please allow us  to recommend another unit that would be better suited for that noise level.

CHECK-OUT 
Check-out is by 10am.  If you check out late or do not follow the check-out steps, you may be charged an additional cleaning fee. Luggage storage may be available from 10am-3pm if arranged in advance.

- Dirty linens can be left as is with used beds left unmade. 
- Please bag all trash and dispose in black bins behind building. Recycling goes into blue bins and should be loose or in an open brown bag.
- Please wash dirty kitchen items and leave to dry.

description:
I spend much of my free time working on home upgrades. As you can see my home is very artistic.  Self made beds, walls, art, deck, furniture, etc. I take much pride in my home. I added a very special touch by bringing a Ducati super-bike inside the apartment, giving it a superb and fancy look. 

I look forward to hosting and making both your experience and my experience pleasant.

No Parties are allowed or smoking!

Treat my home like you would yours.
Welcome!!!

What makes this home unique it‚Äôs the decour, self made art, self made beds and walls.  Luxury and fun is what this home is about. Therefore decided to take it to a whole new level by adding a Ducati super bike inside the unit. 

Please no parties.
house_rules:
Smoking not allowed. 
Parties NOT ALLOWED.
Quiet time after 11pm.
No loud music. 
No loud speaking in balcony or deck. 

Be respectful of neighbors.
Never park In the back.  


This isn‚Äôt a home to host parties.

Please no moving or sitting on the motorcycle.  Ducati is here for display purposes only.

access: Guest will also have access to a fully equipped kitchen. May use as long as you clean after yourself.
description:
Master bedroom suite in a townhome 1 block from the Lakefront and beaches.  Close to public transit, museums, stadiums & McCormick Place.  Free parking.  Be Downtown or Hyde Park in minutes. Close to University of Chicago, IIT, UIC and Loop campuses. #

We offer a completely remodeled, furnished master bedroom featuring a plush queen size bed in a large, luxurious town home located near the Chicago Loop. Also, you'll have your own private, full bathroom.  Linens are also provided.

Includes free parking, WiFi, cable, a fully-equipped modern kitchen and complete access to the dining and living rooms. Long-term stays are available as well. 

There may be additional guests staying in the other bedrooms during your stay which is great for meeting new people and networking.  Essentially, we offer guests the convenience of a boutique hotel while providing the comfort of home. 

We're just a few blocks away from Chicago's lakefront, providing great bike trails, running paths, beaches and gardens, not to mention views of one of the world's most scenic waterfront skylines. We're also close to McCormick Place, University of Chicago, Hyde Park, UIC, IIT and many downtown universities, as well many local attractions and historical sites. 

Getting around is easy as we're only a block away from a public transit stop. There, you can catch a bus that'll take you directly downtown in minutes or you can transfer to the subway for connecting to all parts of the city, including both airports. 

If you have a car there is ample, free street parking and the Loop is only a 10 minute drive. 

This is a great place for you if you'd like to be close to the energy of Chicago's vibrant Loop but want to experience a unique, local neighborhood.

For trust and safety, there is a security camera in the main living area.

Guest will also have access to a fully equipped kitchen. May use as long as you clean after yourself.

We'll provide city guides and public transit info via Acehopper, the "front desk concierge" app, available for iPhone, iPad and Android devices, for tickets, guides and tips on local places to visit. 

If we're around, we also like to entertain. We'll definitely make your stay a comfortable and memorable visit to the area.  Sometimes we're busy, but we'll do our best to accommodate your needs.

Experience the city like a true, native Chicagoan.   Close to several parks and restaurants. Only a block away from the beautiful Chicago Lakefront and Beaches!  Plenty of trails for biking, walking and jogging.  Enjoy water sports at the nearby harbor:
- Jet skis
- Kayaks
- Flyboards
- Paddleboards
Plus spectacular views of Chicago's magnificent skyline.

Nearest public transit is less than one block away, arriving every 5-10 minutes.  Bike shares are available nearby.  Just download Acehopper for iPhone and Android for public transit times, bike sharing availability and info for local events and attractions, including maps and tickets for purchase direct from your phone or tablet.

DIRECTIONS FROM O'HARE INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT

Travel Time: Approximately 1 hour 22 mins 
1. Take Blue Line towardsForest Park.
2. Exit Blue Line at Clark/Lake stop.
3. Transfer to Green Line towards Cottage Grove or Ashland/63rd.
4. Exit at 35-Bronzeville-IIT stop.
5. Transfer to 35 bus eastbound.
6. Exit 35 bus at Cottage Grove and 35th.
7. Walk 1 block south to 36th and 1 block east to Ellis (Townhouse is on this block).

DIRECTIONS FROM CHICAGO MIDWAY AIRPORT

Travel Time: Approximately 59 minutes 
1. Take Orange Line toward Loop.
2. Exit Orange Line at 35th/Archer stop.
3. Transfer to 35 bus eastbound. 
4. Exit 35 bus at Cottage Grove and 35th.
5. Walk 1 block south to 36th and 1 block east to Ellis (Townhouse is on this block).

access: Guests will be able to access the top floor suite, the downstairs laundry room, and the backyard space.
description:
This classic Chicago style bungalow features a private guest suite just minutes away from downtown Chicago and Midway airport. The master bedroom includes a large king size bed and two closets for extra storage. An extra long kitchenette provides ample counter space for guests, as well as coffee, tea, and light breakfast options. Read, relax, or play games while enjoying the natural light of the cozy sitting area. This convenient space also comes with a garage parking spot for guests.

Guests can access the space through the side door. Keys can be found in a lock box next to the door. Once entering guests can make their way up to the top suite by following the Sleepy Hollow Inn signs.

Guests will be able to access the top floor suite, the downstairs laundry room, and the backyard space.

Hosts will be available as needed for guests during the stay.

Garfield Ridge is a quiet and safe neighborhood on Chicago's southwest side. It features a number of authentic coffee shops, restaurants, and bars.

Guests can commute to downtown Chicago via I-55 if driving or can take the Orange Line for public transportation.

Hosts live in unit below and will be available as needed during the stay.

access:
All guests have access to the entire first floor unit and one parking spot in the driveway. (Additional parking spots may be available if needed.)

Closet with a lock in the middle rooms is for the cleaning crew. Please do not try to open.

It is very important that if you park on the drive way you DO NOT block the sidewalk. You will receive a citation.

Please be mindful of the other tenants that live in the building complex.
description:
Our newly remodeled apartment with free parking is located in Little Village-the mecca of the authentic Mexican food and Culture.  The California Pink Line Station is nearby allowing our guest to explore the nightlife that the city of Chicago has to offer in downtown and nearby neighborhoods like the West loop, University Village, Wicker Park, Wrigleyville and Pilsen.

The Space:
Your Chicago home offers 3 bedrooms, one closet, and 1 bathroom. We also have an optional air mattress for additional guest if needed. We also offer Internet, smart TV, and AC unit for the summer months in order to make your stay as comfortable as possible. The kitchen has all your cooking and eating essentials: pot, pans, plates, cups/mugs, basic spices, coffee and coffee maker. Brand new stainless steel appliances (fridge, stove/oven, microwave/range), granite counter tops and plenty of cabinet space for those who are staying longer.

All guests have access to the entire first floor unit and one parking spot in the driveway. (Additional parking spots may be available if needed.)

Closet with a lock in the middle rooms is for the cleaning crew. Please do not try to open.

It is very important that if you park on the drive way you DO NOT block the sidewalk. You will receive a citation.

Please be mindful of the other tenants that live in the building complex.

We can provide guest with recommendations of our favorite restaurants, bar, clubs, shopping centers, bike trails and more! Guest will have complete privacy ,but we will be available to answer any questions or help out in anyway.

"Bienvenidos a Little Village!‚Äù Your home is located on a quiet corner in the predominantly Hispanic neighborhood of little village. Little village is home to many working class families and some young college students but is not as gentrified as its neighbor to the east (Pilsen neighborhood). Meaning you can‚Äôt walk down the street to many bars or coffee shops. Instead, you will be staying between the neighborhoods two main commercial streets: 26th Street and Cermak Rd. Here you will find some unique mom & pop shops that have been in business for years! They sell everything from jewelry, clothes, cowboy gear and many items from Mexico. I would recommend all guest visit the ‚ÄúDiscount mall‚Äù on 26th street!

There are many great restaurants in the neighborhood such as:
¬∑      Mi Tierra en la Villita
¬∑       Taqueria El Milagro
¬∑      La Villita Restaurant
¬∑      La Casa de Samuel,
¬∑      Taqueria Los Comales.
Also nearby :
¬∑      Laguanitas Brewery
¬∑      Dulcelandia (Mexican culture candy store)
¬∑      Pete‚Äôs Fresh Market (grocery store)
¬∑       Walmart
¬∑       Panda Express,
 
Explore everything the city has to offer within 30 mins!
¬∑      Millennium park (The Bean)- about 15- 20 mins via Uber or 30 min bus ride CTA 60 Blue island /26th street ($2.25 per person).
¬∑      Downtown (General)-15- 20 mins
¬∑      Pilsen Bars- 8-10 min drive
¬∑      Midway Airport -15-20 min Drive/ Uber ride.
¬∑      Ohare International Airport- 30 min drive (without traffic!)
¬∑      Wrigley field (Cubs game)- 30 min drive
¬∑      Guaranteed Rate Field (Sox game)- 15 mins
¬∑      United Center (Bulls/Blackhawk games)- 12 min drive
¬∑      University village bars- 15 min drive

We do not charge a cleaning fee if you leave the apartment as you found it with exception to the beds! We change the sheets and blankets after every visit.

The Flats at Loyola Station reserves the right to change room assignments and occupancy levels or to terminate or refuse to accept a housing agreement, in the interest of health, discipline, housing needs, or welfare of the occupant or other occupants. The occupant will pay for any damages to his/her unit and unit furnishings.  Liability charges done in corridors, stairs, washrooms, and common areas of The Flats at Loyola Station Guesthouse will be divided among all occupants staying in the guesthouse, unless the responsible person(s) is (are) determined. The occupant(s) shall not move guesthouse furniture out of his/her room. The occupant(s) is (are) required to comply with the laws of the United States of America, the state of Illinois, all ordinances and regulations of the city of Chicago as well as The Flats at Loyola Station policies, procedures, rules, and regulations.  Failure on the part of the occupant(s) to comply with these laws, ordinances, policies, procedures, rules and regulations, shall constitute breach of contractual agreement and may result in fine, removal from guesthouse, and/or cancelation of this agreement at the option of The Flats at Loyola Station.

description:
Stay at The Flats at Loyola Station and experience all Chicago has to offer! This modern apartment is just steps away from the red line, giving you access to all of Chicago. The kitchen has modern appliances so you can have a night in and cook whatever you'd like! We also provide eco-friendly toiletries!

Received 2017 & 2015 Certificate of Excellence from TripAdvisor!

1 BR unit sleeps four comfortably. Queen size bed in bedroom, living room with queen size pull-out couch, fully stocked kitchen, cable, and washer/dryer in unit. Also includes patio with electric grill upon request.

We have a 24-hour duty phone for emergencies at any time. This number is provided to you one week before checkin.

Rogers Park is a vibrant Chicago neighborhood filled with nightlife and a variety restaurants offering worldly cuisines. It is also just a 30-min train ride or 20-min car drive from downtown Chicago.

The "EL" train and numerous bus stops are just steps away from our building. The area is also saturated with Uber and Lyft drivers.

description:
The Vanderpool House has a Private Suite in a historic 100 year old Chicago Bungalow just 2 blocks away from the 2nd largest transit center in Chicago. The Blue Line L stop will take you downtown, the airport, or the Rosemont Convention Center. The Metra train will take you downtown or the northwest suburbs and you have 13 bus lines will take you anywhere else. Onsite parking is available at no extra charge.

Theaters, Neighborhood Restaurants, Art Museums within walking distance.

Has a queen size bed in bedroom with private bath (tub & shower), kitchen & living room.  Couch can be pulled out to sleep 2 more people. We also have a blowup air mattress available to sleep two more people.

Guest have access to all the rooms

We are more than happy to help you plan your stay in Chicago.

One of the most safest neighborhoods in Chicago with 4 city parks within walking distance.

Just 2 blocks away from the 2nd largest transit center in Chicago. The Blue Line stop will take you downtown or the airport, the Metra train will take you downtown or the northwest suburbs and you have 13 bus lines will take you anywhere else.  2 blocks from an exit on Interstate 90 (the Kennedy Expressway) and 5 blocks from an exit on Interstate 94 (the Edens Expressway).

The backyard patio is available for are guests to use.

additional_house_rules:
*Respect our property. Leave the condo in the same condition it was when you arrived.  
*Pets must be approved before booking. We accept pets, depending on it's size and breed.  The pet fee is $75 per pet.  There is a two dog maximum allowed in our building.  Guests agree to clean up any pet hair on a regular basis. If there is excessive hair to cleaned up after check out, there will be an additional $75 fee. 
* NO SMOKING or drug use in the unit, or on the back porch. 
* Respect the neighbors by keeping noise and music at a moderate level.  Limit walking in high heels or hard souls inside the condo.
* For everyone's safety and security, ensure all doors and gates are closed securely and locked. 
*To avoid tripping a circuit breaker, please urn off the a/c unit if you need to use high-wattage appliances, such as, hair dryer, vacuum, iron, etc.  

CHECK OUT INSTRUCTIONS:
*Place dirty linens and towels in laundry area.  
*Remove all trash/recycle and dispose in dumpsters located in the alley, on the west side of the building.  
*Remove all food from refrigerator.
*Ensure windows are closed and locked, ensure front and doors are closed and locked.  
*If furniture was moved, place back to it's original location.
*If appliances, clocks, or lamps were unplugged, plug back in. Set clocks to correct time.
*Leave a set of keys in the lock box. 
*Please report known items that are broken and need replaced or repaired.

access: Entire condo and courtyard patio.
description:
Large beautiful vintage condo fully equipped with 42" LCD TV w/cable, stainless steel and granite kitchen, laundry in unit, custom walk-in closet, brand new king-size bed, and comfortable queen sofa bed in living room.

Beautifully furnished, large 1-bedroom vintage condo in the heart of Frank Lloyd Wright District. Conveniently located near the Green & Blue  "L" stations and Metra train.  Only a 20 min train ride to downtown Chicago, and 20 minute drive from O'Hare  and Midway Airport. Restaurants, shopping, churches, and parks are within walking distance.  It's an urban residential area with lush tree-lined streets.  Enjoy a stroll down the streets of Oak Park while viewing the beautiful historic homes.  

The condo is in a quiet courtyard building on first floor, one flight of stairs up from street level.  There is a community patio with table and chairs in the rear courtyard. The living room has a sleeper sofa, 42" LCD TV, with Comcast Xfinity & internet, and DVD player.  The bedroom is large with a new king size bed, with quality bedding. The bedroom has an office armoire, which is equipped with a pull-out shelf for your laptop, and a printer. The kitchen has stainless steel and granite counter tops, with plenty of dishes, glassware, and cooking utensils.  Off the kitchen, there is a small laundry area.   

Enjoy the comfort of my home during your visit to historic Oak Park.  You are sure to have a wonderful time!  ~ Kristin :)

Entire condo and courtyard patio.

I'll be available to answer guests questions and concerns in a timely manner.

Historic charm, fabulous restaurants, friendly people, diverse community, and beautiful streets for walking.

Within one mile to green and blue "L" train station.  20 minute train ride to downtown.

Complimentary street parking is available to guests through the Village of Oak Park.  You'll be able to park within one block of my building. There is a convenient 15 minute parking zone in the back of my building with easy access to the rear of my condo unit.  It's great for unloading and loading of luggage, groceries, etc.
